original: @303a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @303a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: gu na n'a p'u ra ni n'a ma sha dam ga yo ga di ppa na /
analyzed: gu na n'a p'u ra ni n'a ma sha dam ga yo ga di ppa na /
translated: Gunapūranī-nāma-ṣaḍangayogadīpa

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: rnal 'byor yan lag drug gi brjed byang yon tan gyis 'gengs pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: rnal 'byor yan lag drug gi brjed byang yon tan gyis 'gengs pa zhes bya ba /
translated: The Memorandum Filling with Qualities of the Six-Branched Yoga

original: dpal dus kyi 'khor lo la phyag 'tshal lo //🔽dpal dus 'khor lo dbang phyug dang ni yon tan gyis //
analyzed: dpal dus kyi 'khor lo la phyag 'tshal lo // dpal dus 'khor lo dbang phyug dang ni yon tan gyis //
translated: Homage to the glorious Kālacakra.

original: che ba'i bla ma rnams la bdag gis phyag 'tshal nas //🔽dpal dang ldan pa rnal 'byor yan lag drug la ni //
analyzed: che ba'i bla ma rnams la bdag gis phyag 'tshal nas // dpal dang ldan pa rnal 'byor yan lag drug la ni //
translated: I pay homage to the glorious lord of the Kālacakra and the great gurus with qualities,🔽and having paid homage to them,🔽I will compose a memorandum filling with qualities

original: yon tan rnams kyis 'gengs par byed pa'i brjed byang bya //
analyzed: yon tan rnams kyis 'gengs par byed pa'i brjed byang bya //
translated: in the glorious Six-Branched Yoga.🔽Here, the master Anupamarakṣita, whose mindstream is accustomed to the meditation on outer and inner knowledge,

original: 'dir nges par phyi dang nang gi rig pa la bsgom pa goms par gyur pa'i thugs gyur pa'i thugs rgyud can slob dpon dpe med 'tsho dmigs pa dang rtog pa med pa'i de khon nyid kyi man ngag bsgoms pas /
analyzed: 'dir nges par phyi dang nang gi rig pa la bsgom pa goms par gyur pa'i thugs gyur pa'i thugs rgyud can slob dpon dpe med 'tsho dmigs pa dang rtog pa med pa'i de khon nyid kyi man ngag bsgoms pas /
translated: having meditated on the instructions of reality free from visualization and conceptualization,

original: dpal kharsa p'a ni'i drung du lo bcu gnyis bzhugs par gyur to //
analyzed: dpal kharsa p'a ni'i drung du lo bcu gnyis bzhugs par gyur to //
translated: dwelt in the presence of the glorious Khasarpāṇi for twelve years.

original: der yang rtog pa'i khyad par ma byung ba las yid zhum nas yid kyi dbang du gyur pa de la rdo rje rnal 'byor mas bstan par gyur te /
analyzed: der yang rtog pa'i khyad par ma byung ba las yid zhum nas yid kyi dbang du gyur pa de la rdo rje rnal 'byor mas bstan par gyur te /
translated: There, too, because no special thought occurred to him, he became depressed and fell under the power of his mind. Vajrayoginī appeared to him and taught him.

original: bu bi kra ma'i grong du song shig / der khyed la rtog pa'i khyad par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: bu bi kra ma'i grong du song shig / der khyed la rtog pa'i khyad par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: “Son, go to the town of Vikrama. There a special thought will occur to you.”

original: de yang bka' de spyi bor bzhag nas de'i dus kyi slob ma pandi ta chen po legs pa'i bu dpal 'dzin rjes su 'brang bzhin pas bi kra ma'i grong du gshegs so //
analyzed: de yang bka' de spyi bor bzhag nas de'i dus kyi slob ma pandi ta chen po legs pa'i bu dpal 'dzin rjes su 'brang bzhin pas bi kra ma'i grong du gshegs so //
translated: He placed that command on the crown of his head and, following the great scholar disciple of that time, Śrīdhara, he went to the town of Vikrama.

original: der yang tshigs mtshams kyi nyin zhag 'ga' zhig la mtshan phyed kyi dus su kun spangs pa'i cha lugs can /
analyzed: der yang tshigs mtshams kyi nyin zhag 'ga' zhig la mtshan phyed kyi dus su kun spangs pa'i cha lugs can /
translated: There, too, for several days at the end of the rainy season, at midnight, he saw the Blessed One in the guise of a renunciate.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dngos su nye bar bstan te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dngos su nye bar bstan te /
translated: He directly revealed himself and said,

original: kye @303b bu 'di ni kho na nyid do zhes so //
analyzed: kye @303b bu 'di ni kho na nyid do zhes so //
translated: “Oh son, this is reality.”

original: de yang man ngag de thos pa tsam gyis ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs par gyur to //
analyzed: de yang man ngag de thos pa tsam gyis ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs par gyur to //
translated: By merely hearing that instruction, he entered into meditative equipoise.

original: bcom ldan 'das de yang de'i tshe mi snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de yang de'i tshe mi snang bar gyur to //
translated: The Blessed One then disappeared.

original: de'i tshe de ma thag tu mtshan mo 'das shing de yang ting nge 'dzin las langs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe de ma thag tu mtshan mo 'das shing de yang ting nge 'dzin las langs so //
translated: At that time, the night passed immediately and he arose from samādhi.

original: dpal ldan bla ma bdag nyid chen po des kyang rnam pa thams cad kyang der dka' ba mdzad cing /
analyzed: dpal ldan bla ma bdag nyid chen po des kyang rnam pa thams cad kyang der dka' ba mdzad cing /
translated: The glorious great guru also performed all the hardships there.

original: skal pa dang ldan pa'i dpal ldan dpal 'dzin la rang gi rtog pa nye bar bstan to //
analyzed: skal pa dang ldan pa'i dpal ldan dpal 'dzin la rang gi rtog pa nye bar bstan to //
translated: To the fortunate glorious Śrīdhara, he revealed his own realization.

original: dpal ldan bla ma mchog tu thugs rje can des kyang rnam pa thams cad du snod dang ldan par rtogs nas pandi ta chen po 'od byed lha la bka' drin du mdzad do //
analyzed: dpal ldan bla ma mchog tu thugs rje can des kyang rnam pa thams cad du snod dang ldan par rtogs nas pandi ta chen po 'od byed lha la bka' drin du mdzad do //
translated: That glorious supreme compassionate guru, realizing him to be a suitable vessel in every way, bestowed kindness upon the great paṇḍita Prabhāvatīdeva.

original: des kyang pandi ta chen po rgyal ba'i bla ma snyigs ma'i dus kyi thams cad mkhyen pa chos kyi 'byung gnas zhi ba la bshad do //
analyzed: des kyang pandi ta chen po rgyal ba'i bla ma snyigs ma'i dus kyi thams cad mkhyen pa chos kyi 'byung gnas zhi ba la bshad do //
translated: He also explained it to the great paṇḍita Jinamitra, the omniscient one of the degenerate age, the source of Dharma, Śānti.

original: kha na mtho ba med pa'i thugs rje la sogs pa'i yon tan brjod du med pa'i rin po che'i 'byung gnas dpal ldan bla ma de las kyang /
analyzed: kha na mtho ba med pa'i thugs rje la sogs pa'i yon tan brjod du med pa'i rin po che'i 'byung gnas dpal ldan bla ma de las kyang /
translated: From that glorious guru, the source of precious, inexpressible qualities, such as compassion that is free of faults,

original: dpal ldan bla ma'i zhabs bsten pa la mkhas pa nyi ma dpal bdag gis de kho na nyid yang dag par thob bo zhes pa bla ma'i brgyud pa'o //
analyzed: dpal ldan bla ma'i zhabs bsten pa la mkhas pa nyi ma dpal bdag gis de kho na nyid yang dag par thob bo zhes pa bla ma'i brgyud pa'o //
translated: the one skilled in attending to the feet of the glorious guru, Nyima Pal, has attained the perfect suchness.

original: de ltar slob ma dam pas gsol ba btab pa'i dbang las slob dpon dpe med 'tsho zhes bya bas rdo rje 'dzin pa'i go 'phang 'thob pa'i rgyu rnal 'byor yan lag drug mdzad par bzhed pas /
analyzed: de ltar slob ma dam pas gsol ba btab pa'i dbang las slob dpon dpe med 'tsho zhes bya bas rdo rje 'dzin pa'i go 'phang 'thob pa'i rgyu rnal 'byor yan lag drug mdzad par bzhed pas /
translated: Thus, the excellent disciple having made a request, the master called Asanga, wishing to compose the six-branched yoga, the cause for attaining the state of Vajradhara,

original: rang gi 'dod pa'i lha la bstod pa'i sgo nas rnal 'byor yan lag drug gsal bar mdzad de /🔽kun la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pa'i lha la bstod pa'i sgo nas rnal 'byor yan lag drug gsal bar mdzad de / kun la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: clarified the six-branched yoga through praise to his chosen deity.🔽The verse begins with to all.

original: thams cad la sgrib par byed do zhes pa kun la sgrib pa'i sprin gyi dra ba ste /
analyzed: thams cad la sgrib par byed do zhes pa kun la sgrib pa'i sprin gyi dra ba ste /
translated: The word all refers to the net of clouds that obscures everything.

original: sprin gyi tshogs rnams gang du bsal zhing spangs pa de ni skad de der ro //
analyzed: sprin gyi tshogs rnams gang du bsal zhing spangs pa de ni skad de der ro //
translated: Where the mass of clouds is dispelled and abandoned, that is the sky there.

original: gang du 'khrul ba'i ngang tshul can nyid kyi phyir rnam rtog dang / phyogs can dang mtshungs pa'i rlung ste /
analyzed: gang du 'khrul ba'i ngang tshul can nyid kyi phyir rnam rtog dang / phyogs can dang mtshungs pa'i rlung ste /
translated: Where the wind, which is like the conceptualization and the directionality, is extinguished, that is the sky there.🔽The wind is so called because it is the cause of conceptualization and directionality.

original: dbugs rnams grangs ma lus pa mtha' dag nyid nub ste zhig pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs rnams grangs ma lus pa mtha' dag nyid nub ste zhig pa'o //
translated: The wind is extinguished, that is, it ceases completely, without remainder.

original: de'i phyir yang rang gi nam mkha'i khams su ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang rang gi nam mkha'i khams su ste /
translated: Therefore, in one's own realm of space,

original: ston ka'i nam mkha' dri ma med pa'i dkyil du shar zhing gsal bar gyur ba 'od bzang po can te /
analyzed: ston ka'i nam mkha' dri ma med pa'i dkyil du shar zhing gsal bar gyur ba 'od bzang po can te /
translated: the excellent light arises and becomes manifest in the middle of the stainless autumn sky.

original: dge zhing bde ba'i 'od can 'jig rten dbang phyug sangs rgyas sam padma'i phyag can no //
analyzed: dge zhing bde ba'i 'od can 'jig rten dbang phyug sangs rgyas sam padma'i phyag can no //
translated: It is the light of the auspicious and blissful Lord of the World, the Buddha, the lotus-handed one.

original: de nyid ni skye bo rnams dga' bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir zla ba gang ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni skye bo rnams dga' bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir zla ba gang ba'o //
translated: That very [light] is the full moon, because it delights people.

original: zla ba yang thams cad sbyar bar @304a * //
analyzed: zla ba yang thams cad sbyar bar @304a * //
translated: The full moon is the union of all things.

original: bya'o ; ; nang gi don dang bcas pa ni kun la sgrib pa'i sprin gyi dra ba bsal ba la ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs par sgro btags dang bral ba la ste /
analyzed: bya'o ; ; nang gi don dang bcas pa ni kun la sgrib pa'i sprin gyi dra ba bsal ba la ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs par sgro btags dang bral ba la ste /
translated: The inner meaning is that the removal of the net of clouds of obscurations in all is in freedom from the superimposition of apprehended and apprehender, and so on.

original: 'dis ni so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan gyi yan lag gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan gyi yan lag gsungs so //
translated: This teaches the branches of withdrawal and meditative concentration.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'ang /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'ang /
translated: Also, the one to be explained:

original: so sor sdud pa yul la yul dang yul can bcu rnams rab tu 'jug pa med pa'o //
analyzed: so sor sdud pa yul la yul dang yul can bcu rnams rab tu 'jug pa med pa'o //
translated: Withdrawal is the non-engagement of the ten objects and subjects.

original: bsam gtan yang ni shes rab rtog dang dpyod pa dga' dang g-yo med bde bar sems rtse gcig pa'o //🔽zhes pa'o // rlung dang rnam par rtog phyir 'gro ba med pa'i phyir bag chags dang bcas pa'i sems kyis skad cig stod phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi'i mtshan nyid can dang / srog dang thur sel gyi rlung rnams kyang grangs ma lus pa gang gis sam /
analyzed: bsam gtan yang ni shes rab rtog dang dpyod pa dga' dang g-yo med bde bar sems rtse gcig pa'o // zhes pa'o // rlung dang rnam par rtog phyir 'gro ba med pa'i phyir bag chags dang bcas pa'i sems kyis skad cig stod phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi'i mtshan nyid can dang / srog dang thur sel gyi rlung rnams kyang grangs ma lus pa gang gis sam /
translated: Meditative concentration is the one-pointed mind of non-conceptual wisdom, free from joy and movement, and bliss.

original: gang du nub cing 'gags par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gang du nub cing 'gags par gyur pa ste /
translated: The winds and conceptual thoughts do not go out, and the mind with its habitual tendencies, which has the characteristics of 84,000 moments, and the winds of life and downward-clearing, all without exception, by what and where do they subside and cease?

original: 'dis kyang srog rtsol dang 'dzin pa'i yan lag dag gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis kyang srog rtsol dang 'dzin pa'i yan lag dag gsungs so //
translated: This also teaches the prāṇa-āyāma and retention limbs.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And so it is said:

original: srog gi rtsol ba yang ni lam ni gnyis po sgyel zhing dbu mar srog ni zhugs par 'gyur //
analyzed: srog gi rtsol ba yang ni lam ni gnyis po sgyel zhing dbu mar srog ni zhugs par 'gyur //
translated: Prāṇa-āyāma is the reversal of the two paths and the entry of prāṇa into the central nāḍī.

original: thig ler srog rab zhugs shing gnyis ka'i bgrod pa sems rtse gcig pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: thig ler srog rab zhugs shing gnyis ka'i bgrod pa sems rtse gcig pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The retention of the mind is the single-pointed mind that travels to the bindu where prāṇa has entered.

original: zhes pa'o // rang gi bdag nyid kyi sems so //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // rang gi bdag nyid kyi sems so //
translated: One’s own mind.

original: de nyid nam mkha'i khams yin zhing rnam pa thams cad mthong ba sna tshogs pa'i gzugs ni zla ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid nam mkha'i khams yin zhing rnam pa thams cad mthong ba sna tshogs pa'i gzugs ni zla ba ste /
translated: That itself is the element of space. The moon is the form of all aspects that is seen.

original: 'dis kyang rjes su dran pa'i yan lag gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis kyang rjes su dran pa'i yan lag gsungs so //
translated: This also teaches the limb of recollection.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And so it is said:

original: gtum mo'i snang ba gang zhig lus dang nam mkha' la yang nges par 'gyur ba rjes dran 'gyur //
analyzed: gtum mo'i snang ba gang zhig lus dang nam mkha' la yang nges par 'gyur ba rjes dran 'gyur //
translated: The appearance of caṇḍālī that definitely arises in the body and space is recollection.

original: zhes so // shar ba ni gtum mos reg pa las gtsug tor gyi 'khor lo las 'ongs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes so // shar ba ni gtum mos reg pa las gtsug tor gyi 'khor lo las 'ongs pa ste /
translated: Arisen means that which comes from the cakra of the uṣṇīṣa through the contact of caṇḍālī.

original: snang ba med pa rab tu gsal ba nyid kyi phyir 'od bzang can no //
analyzed: snang ba med pa rab tu gsal ba nyid kyi phyir 'od bzang can no //
translated: Since it is very clear without appearance, it is beautiful light.

original: de 'jig rten thams cad kyi rten nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: de 'jig rten thams cad kyi rten nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: Since it is the very support of the entire world,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyi bor dang / rdo rje'i rtse mor gzung ba nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten dbang phyug go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyi bor dang / rdo rje'i rtse mor gzung ba nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten dbang phyug go //
translated: it is the Lord of the World, because it is held to be on the crown of the heads of all Buddhas and at the tip of the vajra.

original: dga' ba bcu drug gi khu ba nyid kyi phyir gang ba'i zla ba ste phyin tshig sdud do //
analyzed: dga' ba bcu drug gi khu ba nyid kyi phyir gang ba'i zla ba ste phyin tshig sdud do //
translated: It is the full moon, because it is the very essence of the sixteen joys.

original: 'dis kyang ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dis kyang ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag gsungs te /
translated: This also teaches the branch of samadhi.

original: shes rab thabs kyi bdag nyid ni 'gyur med bde ba'i dbang gis ye shes gzugs la ting nge 'dzin zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi bdag nyid ni 'gyur med bde ba'i dbang gis ye shes gzugs la ting nge 'dzin zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The nature of wisdom and means is called samadhi, because of the power of unchanging bliss in the form of gnosis.

original: gsal bar gyur cig rgyal bar gyur cig @304b pa'o ;
analyzed: gsal bar gyur cig rgyal bar gyur cig @304b pa'o ;
translated: May it be clear! May it be victorious!

original: /'dis ni phyag 'tshal ba yang 'phangs te /
analyzed: /'dis ni phyag 'tshal ba yang 'phangs te /
translated: This also implies homage,

original: des ni de la rab tu 'dud do zhes mtshon bar bya'o //
analyzed: des ni de la rab tu 'dud do zhes mtshon bar bya'o //
translated: because it is said that thereby one bows down to it.

original: da ni rnal 'byor yan lag drug po 'di gang brjed par bya ba de 'gal bar snang ba'i sgo nas rtogs par byed pa gsungs te //
analyzed: da ni rnal 'byor yan lag drug po 'di gang brjed par bya ba de 'gal bar snang ba'i sgo nas rtogs par byed pa gsungs te //
translated: Now, in order to understand what is to be forgotten in these six branches of yoga, he says this, which is to be understood by way of the appearance of contradiction:

original: gang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The one who is free from the perception of the two truths, the Lord, is the Great Hero.🔽The Lord, who is free from the perception of the two truths, is the Great Hero.

original: mgon po gang zhig 'khor bar skye ba dang 'chi ba'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / zhi ba de chad pa don dam pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: mgon po gang zhig 'khor bar skye ba dang 'chi ba'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / zhi ba de chad pa don dam pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: The two truths are the conventional truth of birth and death in saṃsāra, and the ultimate truth of the cessation of peace.

original: de dag so sor dmigs pa ni kun nas dmigs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de dag so sor dmigs pa ni kun nas dmigs par byed pa ste /
translated: The perception of those two is the perception of the two.

original: de dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir de skad du'o //
analyzed: de dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir de skad du'o //
translated: He is so called because he is free from that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa de dag las tha dad med par gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo zung 'jug go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa de dag las tha dad med par gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo zung 'jug go //
translated: For that very reason, he is the union of the two, whose nature is nondual, without distinction from those conventional and ultimate truths.

original: 'jig rten gsum pa dang gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir khyab bdag go //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum pa dang gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir khyab bdag go //
translated: He is the Lord because he is of the same nature as the three worlds.

original: stong pa dang shin tu stong pa dang / stong pa chen po dang / thams cad stong pa nyid kyis 'od gsal ba nyid kyi phyir stong pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa dang shin tu stong pa dang / stong pa chen po dang / thams cad stong pa nyid kyis 'od gsal ba nyid kyi phyir stong pa ste /
translated: He is empty because he is luminous with emptiness, utter emptiness, great emptiness, and the emptiness of all things.

original: rdul phra rab kyi chos nyid las 'das pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi chos nyid las 'das pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he transcends the nature of subtle particles.

original: me long gi gzugs brnyan lta bu'i rnam pa thams cad mchog dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir brtse ba'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: me long gi gzugs brnyan lta bu'i rnam pa thams cad mchog dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir brtse ba'i rang bzhin te /
translated: It is loving by nature, because it is endowed with the supreme of all aspects, like a reflection in a mirror.

original: rnam pa kun ldan rnam pa med //
analyzed: rnam pa kun ldan rnam pa med //
translated: Endowed with all aspects, yet without aspects.

original: ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: ces pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the above verse.

original: gnas pa las 'das pa ni dmigs pa la chags pa'i sems te /
analyzed: gnas pa las 'das pa ni dmigs pa la chags pa'i sems te /
translated: It is beyond abiding, because the mind is attached to an objective reference.

original: gnas pa med pa'i tshul gyis legs par gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnas pa med pa'i tshul gyis legs par gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is well-established in the manner of non-abiding. This is the meaning of the above verse.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ye shes rab tu gyur pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par ni sa rnams te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ye shes rab tu gyur pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par ni sa rnams te /
translated: The stages of the transformation of non-conceptual intuition are the stages.

original: de rnams kyi dbang phyug ni sa bcu gnyis kyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dbang phyug ni sa bcu gnyis kyi dbang phyug go //
translated: Its sovereignty is the sovereignty of the twelve stages.

original: rtogs ldan rnams ni rtog med kyi ye shes man ngag la mkhas pa rnams kyi'o ;
analyzed: rtogs ldan rnams ni rtog med kyi ye shes man ngag la mkhas pa rnams kyi'o ;
translated: The realization of those skilled in the esoteric instructions is the realization of those skilled in the esoteric instructions of non-conceptual intuition.

original: / nyams med bde ba ni mchog tu mi 'gyur bar 'dod pa lnga la longs spyod pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: / nyams med bde ba ni mchog tu mi 'gyur bar 'dod pa lnga la longs spyod pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: The bliss of non-regression is the bliss of the enjoyment of the five kinds of desire in the supreme non-regression.

original: rgyas par byed pa ni 'phro bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: rgyas par byed pa ni 'phro bar byed pa ste /
translated: It is expansive, because it is extended.

original: rtog pa spangs pa ni gnyis dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa spangs pa ni gnyis dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is free from conceptualization, because it is free from the duality.

original: 'gro ba med /
analyzed: 'gro ba med /
translated: He is without going,

original: mi 'gyur ba med pa nyid kyis na g-yo ba med pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba med pa nyid kyis na g-yo ba med pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: and he is the essence of non-motion, because of the absence of change.

original: 'gro bas nye bar bsten par bya ba nyid kyi phyir mgon po'o //
analyzed: 'gro bas nye bar bsten par bya ba nyid kyi phyir mgon po'o //
translated: He is the protector, because he is to be relied upon by the world.

original: ngag gi spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyis na 'gal lo //
analyzed: ngag gi spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyis na 'gal lo //
translated: He is the opposite, because he is not an object of speech.

original: brgyan par byed gyur cig ni byin gyis rlobs shig pa'o //
analyzed: brgyan par byed gyur cig ni byin gyis rlobs shig pa'o //
translated: May he be the ornament, that is, the consecrator.

original: 'gro ba'i sems ni 'gro yid do //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i sems ni 'gro yid do //
translated: The mind of the world is the mind of the world.

original: sems dang bral ba ni sems med pa'i sems te /
analyzed: sems dang bral ba ni sems med pa'i sems te /
translated: The mind-free is the mind without mind.

original: de yis 'char ro zhes pa @305a * //
analyzed: de yis 'char ro zhes pa @305a * //
translated: By that, he arises.

original: sems dang bral ba 'char ba'o //
analyzed: sems dang bral ba 'char ba'o //
translated: The mind-free arises.

original: 'gal ba'i don ni go sla'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i don ni go sla'o //
translated: The opposite meaning is easy to understand.

original: bla ma sangs rgyas bla ma chos //
analyzed: bla ma sangs rgyas bla ma chos //
translated: The guru is the Buddha, the guru is the Dharma,

original: de bzhin bla ma dge 'dun te //
analyzed: de bzhin bla ma dge 'dun te //
translated: and likewise the guru is the Sangha.

original: dpal ldan bla ma rdo rje 'dzin //
analyzed: dpal ldan bla ma rdo rje 'dzin //
translated: The glorious guru is the Vajra Holder.

original: bla ma nyid kyis 'dir byed rgyu'o //
analyzed: bla ma nyid kyis 'dir byed rgyu'o //
translated: The guru himself is the cause here.

original: zhes bas phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na nyid ston par byed pa'i dpal ldan bla ma dam par gyur pa'i yon tan gsal bar byed pa sngon du 'gro bas phyag 'tshal bar gsungs pa /🔽cung zad ces ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bas phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na nyid ston par byed pa'i dpal ldan bla ma dam par gyur pa'i yon tan gsal bar byed pa sngon du 'gro bas phyag 'tshal bar gsungs pa / cung zad ces ba'o //
translated: Thus, having first made clear the qualities of the glorious holy guru who teaches the unerring reality, he pays homage.🔽A little means a little bit.

original: cung zad rtog pa'i yongs 'dzin ni cung zad kyang yod do zhes khas len pa ste /
analyzed: cung zad rtog pa'i yongs 'dzin ni cung zad kyang yod do zhes khas len pa ste /
translated: The grasping of a little bit is the claim that there is a little bit.

original: yod do zhes dang rtag bar lta ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: yod do zhes dang rtag bar lta ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of it exists and the view of permanence is the same.

original: nyams pa'i ched du ste 'gro ba sdug bsngal gyis 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba'i ched du'o //
analyzed: nyams pa'i ched du ste 'gro ba sdug bsngal gyis 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba'i ched du'o //
translated: For the sake of experience, for the sake of the experience of the suffering of cyclic existence of beings.

original: nges par sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid kyi phyir 'dzin pas bcings pa'o //
analyzed: nges par sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid kyi phyir 'dzin pas bcings pa'o //
translated: Because of being the cause of suffering, grasping is bondage.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i cha de yang gtong ba ni de gtong ste chad par lta ba zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i cha de yang gtong ba ni de gtong ste chad par lta ba zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Giving up that aspect of conceptualization is giving that up, which means the view of annihilation.

original: bab col du spangs par ni rnam par ma bcad pa chad par lta ba'o zhes pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: bab col du spangs par ni rnam par ma bcad pa chad par lta ba'o zhes pa'i bar ro //
translated: Abandoning thoughtlessly is uninterrupted annihilation, up to the view of annihilation.

original: bskal pa mtha' yas par sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid kyi phyir shin tu ring bar thar pa med de /
analyzed: bskal pa mtha' yas par sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid kyi phyir shin tu ring bar thar pa med de /
translated: Since it is the cause of suffering for limitless eons, there is no liberation for a very long time.

original: de yang 'di yin la ltung ba yang ste mnar med pa la sogs pa'i dmyal bar ltung ba'o //
analyzed: de yang 'di yin la ltung ba yang ste mnar med pa la sogs pa'i dmyal bar ltung ba'o //
translated: And that is a downfall, because one falls into the hells of Avīci and so on.

original: de skye ba'i phyir ram de gnyis rab tu skye zhing 'phen par byed pa ni de skad do //
analyzed: de skye ba'i phyir ram de gnyis rab tu skye zhing 'phen par byed pa ni de skad do //
translated: It is so called because it causes one to be born there, or because it propels one to be born there.

original: gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is also said:

original: gang rnams stong pa nyid lta ba //
analyzed: gang rnams stong pa nyid lta ba //
translated: Those who view emptiness

original: de rnams bsgrub tu med par gsungs //
analyzed: de rnams bsgrub tu med par gsungs //
translated: are said to be incapable of practice.

original: zhes so // de ltar rnam pa 'di yis dam pa'i lam bslad par gyur cing grol ba'i lam mi mngon par gyur pa la dpal ldan bla ma gang gis nam mkha'i gzugs brnyan du ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad pa sna tshogs pa'i gzugs sems las las rnams 'das
analyzed: zhes so // de ltar rnam pa 'di yis dam pa'i lam bslad par gyur cing grol ba'i lam mi mngon par gyur pa la dpal ldan bla ma gang gis nam mkha'i gzugs brnyan du ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad pa sna tshogs pa'i gzugs sems las las rnams 'das
translated: In this way, the path of the holy ones is corrupted, and the path to liberation is obscured. The glorious guru, who is like a reflection in the sky, is beyond the scope of the mind.

original: te / sems med pa'i sems kyi ngo bo can mkha' dang brtse ba'i bdag nyid de stong pa nyid dang thugs rje tha mi dad pa ston par mdzad cing /
analyzed: te / sems med pa'i sems kyi ngo bo can mkha' dang brtse ba'i bdag nyid de stong pa nyid dang thugs rje tha mi dad pa ston par mdzad cing /
translated: The teacher, who is the nature of mind, which is not mind, the nature of space and compassion, who is the teacher of the non-differentiation of emptiness and compassion,

original: stsol bar mdzad de slob ma dam pa rnams la zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: stsol bar mdzad de slob ma dam pa rnams la zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: and who is the bestower of the supreme gift, to the supreme disciples, the rest is left over.

original: bla ma mchog dpal ldan bla ma de la phyag 'tshal zhing lus dang ngag dang yid rnams kyis rab tu 'dud do //
analyzed: bla ma mchog dpal ldan bla ma de la phyag 'tshal zhing lus dang ngag dang yid rnams kyis rab tu 'dud do //
translated: I pay homage to that supreme guru, the glorious guru, and I bow down with body, speech, and mind.

original: dga' ba ni rangs pas so //
analyzed: dga' ba ni rangs pas so //
translated: Joy is delight.

original: rtag tu ni dus gsum du'o //
analyzed: rtag tu ni dus gsum du'o //
translated: Always is in the three times.

original: 'on gal bo ste mngon par brjod pa kho na las dam pa'i lam nye bar thob pa yin na de'i tshe @305b bla ma dam pa'i yon tan sgrogs po kho na bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on gal bo ste mngon par brjod pa kho na las dam pa'i lam nye bar thob pa yin na de'i tshe @305b bla ma dam pa'i yon tan sgrogs po kho na bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: But if the path of the supreme is obtained just from the expression, then at that time is it not just the proclamation of the qualities of the supreme guru?

original: ji ltar rnal 'byor yan lag drug pa'i rab tu byed pa rtsom pa zhugs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar rnal 'byor yan lag drug pa'i rab tu byed pa rtsom pa zhugs she na /
translated: How does one engage in the composition of the Yogisatavivarana?

original: gsungs pa / de phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / de phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said: Therefore, etc.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de phyir te de'i phyir rang gi rtogs pa sgrogs pa kho na ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de phyir te de'i phyir rang gi rtogs pa sgrogs pa kho na ni /
translated: Because it is so, therefore.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i bla ma yang dag pa ji lta ba'i lam ston po'i bdag nyid chen po mchog tu thugs brtse ba'i bdag nyid sgrogs shing yon tan gsal bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i bla ma yang dag pa ji lta ba'i lam ston po'i bdag nyid chen po mchog tu thugs brtse ba'i bdag nyid sgrogs shing yon tan gsal bar byed pa ste /
translated: The one who proclaims his own realization is the one who proclaims the greatness of the nature of the perfect guru who is such, who is the teacher of the path of reality just as it is, and who is the one with the nature of supreme compassion.

original: bla ma'i drin gyis thob pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa rab tu gsal bar byed pa kho nas so //
analyzed: bla ma'i drin gyis thob pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa rab tu gsal bar byed pa kho nas so //
translated: He proclaims and makes clear his qualities, and by the clarity of his own mind, which is obtained through the kindness of the guru.

original: don 'di nyid de gzhan bkod pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: don 'di nyid de gzhan bkod pas gsungs pa /
translated: This very meaning is stated by another example:

original: gang gi phyir 'bar ba'i gzugs can me ni med pa na ste me 'bar ba med na du ba'i rtse mo yang dag par 'phyur zhing gsal bar 'dril ba rtogs pa mad pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bar ba'i gzugs can me ni med pa na ste me 'bar ba med na du ba'i rtse mo yang dag par 'phyur zhing gsal bar 'dril ba rtogs pa mad pas so //
translated: Because when the blazing form of fire does not exist, that is, when the blazing of fire does not exist, the realization of the rising and clear coiling of the tip of smoke does not exist.

original: 'dis ni dpal ldan bla ma'i drin kho na las gzhung 'di byed pa la bdag mkhas pa nyid do zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni dpal ldan bla ma'i drin kho na las gzhung 'di byed pa la bdag mkhas pa nyid do zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This explains that he is skilled in composing this treatise only through the kindness of the glorious guru.

original: 'o na nga rgyal thams cad dang bral bas de kho na nyid kyi lam sgrub par byed pa khyod kyis ji ltar nga de kho na nyid shes pa thob pa'o zhes sems mtho bar 'gyur zhe na lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'o na nga rgyal thams cad dang bral bas de kho na nyid kyi lam sgrub par byed pa khyod kyis ji ltar nga de kho na nyid shes pa thob pa'o zhes sems mtho bar 'gyur zhe na lan gsungs pa /
translated: Well, how can you, who are free from all pride, and who are engaged in the path of reality, have a high opinion of yourself, thinking, “I have attained the knowledge of reality”?

original: bdag gi rtog pa'i nga rgyal skyon gyi rgyur 'gyur min te 'gyur ba zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bdag gi rtog pa'i nga rgyal skyon gyi rgyur 'gyur min te 'gyur ba zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: The answer is: “The pride of my thought is not the cause of a fault, but is for the sake of engaging others.”

original: gang gi phyir grol ba don du gnyer ba rnams rab tu 'jug byed nyid kyis gzhan don sgrub par byed pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir grol ba don du gnyer ba rnams rab tu 'jug byed nyid kyis gzhan don sgrub par byed pas so //
translated: Because those who seek liberation are engaged in the welfare of others by being engaged themselves.

original: don 'di yin te rnyed pa la sogs pa re ba'i bsam pas bdag gi shes pa gsal bar byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: don 'di yin te rnyed pa la sogs pa re ba'i bsam pas bdag gi shes pa gsal bar byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: This is the meaning: My knowledge is not made clear by the thought of hoping for gain, etc.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well, then what?

original: srid bas 'jigs pa rnams la thabs kyi dngos po yang dag par bstan pas rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: srid bas 'jigs pa rnams la thabs kyi dngos po yang dag par bstan pas rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i ched du'o //
translated: It is for the sake of engaging those who are afraid of existence by teaching them the means.

original: don gzhan bkod pa gsungs pa //
analyzed: don gzhan bkod pa gsungs pa //
translated: The meaning of the other verse is stated:

original: rab tu 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don 'ga' zhig brjod pa la ste /
analyzed: rab tu 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don 'ga' zhig brjod pa la ste /
translated: “For the sake of expressing some cause of engagement.”

original: bshad pa la rang nyid kyis ma nges pa'i smra ba po 'chad pa po'i skabs las nges pa med cing the tshom za ba na don du gnyer ba'i skye bo 'dod pa 'grub pa'i ched du ji ltar 'jug ste /
analyzed: bshad pa la rang nyid kyis ma nges pa'i smra ba po 'chad pa po'i skabs las nges pa med cing the tshom za ba na don du gnyer ba'i skye bo 'dod pa 'grub pa'i ched du ji ltar 'jug ste /
translated: In the explanation, the speaker is not ascertained from the context, and if one is doubtful, how could one who seeks the meaning engage in it for the purpose of accomplishing what is desired?

original: ma yin pa kho na'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ma yin pa kho na'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not so at all.

original: gang yang smra ba bo ste mngon par brjod pa po dang 'brel ba'i brjod pa'i tshig la ni so so skye bos byas pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa la sogs pa rnams kyis rgyud du ma rnams su drang ba'i don rtogs pas khengs pa'i blo @306a * //
analyzed: gang yang smra ba bo ste mngon par brjod pa po dang 'brel ba'i brjod pa'i tshig la ni so so skye bos byas pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa la sogs pa rnams kyis rgyud du ma rnams su drang ba'i don rtogs pas khengs pa'i blo @306a * //
translated: Also, in the words of expression that are related to the speaker, the one who expresses, the great commentaries composed by ordinary beings and so on, the mantras of the wise who are arrogant due to understanding the provisional meaning,

original: can gyi sngags pa dam pa rnams dmyal bar 'gro ba na ste /
analyzed: can gyi sngags pa dam pa rnams dmyal bar 'gro ba na ste /
translated: the holy mantras go to hell.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis mdzad pa'i rgya cher 'grel gyi dpal dus kyi 'khor lo nyung ngu'i rgyud kyi rgyal por drang ba dang nges pa'i don rnam par dbye ba rab tu rtogs so zhes rgyud kyi rgyal po'i bdag nyid chen po gsal bar byed
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis mdzad pa'i rgya cher 'grel gyi dpal dus kyi 'khor lo nyung ngu'i rgyud kyi rgyal por drang ba dang nges pa'i don rnam par dbye ba rab tu rtogs so zhes rgyud kyi rgyal po'i bdag nyid chen po gsal bar byed
translated: The great lord of tantras, the glorious Wheel of Time Tantra in brief, composed by the noble Avalokiteśvara, is understood to be a differentiation of the provisional and definitive meanings.🔽

original: pa gsungs pa /🔽drang ba zhes pa'o //🔽drang ba'i don ni /
analyzed: pa gsungs pa / drang ba zhes pa'o // drang ba'i don ni /
translated: The noble Avalokiteśvara's commentary on the glorious Kālacakra Small Book Tantra King, called The Realization of the Distinction between the Interpretable and the Definitive, states:

original: de kho na nyid kyi don spangs te gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi don spangs te gsungs pa'o //
translated: The interpretable meaning is that which is taught abandoning the meaning of reality.

original: lam spangs pa rnams ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rnam par dbye ba la mi mkhas pa rnams so //
analyzed: lam spangs pa rnams ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rnam par dbye ba la mi mkhas pa rnams so //
translated: Those who abandon the path are those who are not skilled in the distinction between the conventional and the ultimate.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: shes rab dman pa nyid sgrub pa'i sgo nas te /
analyzed: shes rab dman pa nyid sgrub pa'i sgo nas te /
translated: the distinction between the interpretable and the definitive is taught for the sake of establishing the inferiority of wisdom.🔽The refutations of the position of establishment are not understood

original: bsgrub pa'i phyogs las dgag pa rnams mi rtogs so zhes bya ba ni /🔽rdo rje 'dzin dpal bka' yis ni /
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i phyogs las dgag pa rnams mi rtogs so zhes bya ba ni / rdo rje 'dzin dpal bka' yis ni /
translated: means that🔽the glorious Vajrapāṇi, by the word of the Bhagavat, the glorious Kālacakra,🔽the glorious Vajrapāṇi, by the word of the Bhagavat, the glorious Kālacakra,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dpal dus kyi 'khor lo'i bka' yis so //
translated: the glorious Vajrapāṇi, by the word of the Bhagavat, the glorious Kālacakra,🔽the glorious Vajrapāṇi, by the word of the Bhagavat, the glorious Kālacakra,🔽the glorious Vajrapāṇi, by the word of the Bhagavat, the glorious Kālacakra,🔽the glorious Vajrapāṇi, by the word of the Bhagavat, the glorious Kālacakra,🔽the glorious Vajrapāṇi, by the word of the Bhagavat, the glorious Kālacakra,🔽the glorious Vajrapāṇi, by the word of the Bhagavat, the glorious Kālacakra,🔽the glorious Vajrapāṇi, by the word of the Bhagavat, the glorious Kālacakra,🔽the glorious Vajrapāṇi, by the word of the Bhagavat, the glorious Kālacakra,🔽the glorious Vajrapāṇi, by the word of the Bhagavat, the glorious Kālacakra,🔽the glorious Vajrapāṇi, by the word of the Bhagavat, the glorious Kālacakra,🔽the glorious Vajrapāṇi, by the word of the Bhagavat, the glorious Kālacakra,🔽the glorious Vajrapāṇi, by the word of the Bhagavat, the glorious Kālacakra,🔽the glorious Vajrapāṇi, by the word of the Bhagavat, the glorious Kālacakra,🔽the glorious Vajrapāṇi, by the word of the Bhagavat, the glorious Kālacakra

original: 'jam dpal byang chub sems dpa' chen pos dpal dus kyi 'khor lo nyung du'i rgyud gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal byang chub sems dpa' chen pos dpal dus kyi 'khor lo nyung du'i rgyud gsungs te /
translated: The glorious Kālacakra-tantra in brief was taught by Mañjuśrī, the great bodhisattva.

original: shambhala'i yul du yang dag par bsdu ba mdzad nas bstan to //
analyzed: shambhala'i yul du yang dag par bsdu ba mdzad nas bstan to //
translated: Having been compiled in the land of Shambhala, it was taught.

original: 'dis ni ston pa po dang bsdu ba mdzad pa po ngag gis dang don gyis na gsol ba 'debs pa po dpal phyag na rdo rje'i bdag nyid chen po nyid gsal bar byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni ston pa po dang bsdu ba mdzad pa po ngag gis dang don gyis na gsol ba 'debs pa po dpal phyag na rdo rje'i bdag nyid chen po nyid gsal bar byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: This clarifies that the one who taught and the one who compiled are the great being glorious Vajrapāṇi himself, the one who made the request, in terms of his speech and his meaning.

original: rgyud chen po gang la 'jig rten dbang phyug gi sprul pa'i sku dpal padma dkar po zhes bya bas don thams cad gsal bar byed pa'i phyir thams cad don can dri ma dang bral ba'i 'od ces bya ba'i rgya cher 'grel mdzad de byas par gyur to //
analyzed: rgyud chen po gang la 'jig rten dbang phyug gi sprul pa'i sku dpal padma dkar po zhes bya bas don thams cad gsal bar byed pa'i phyir thams cad don can dri ma dang bral ba'i 'od ces bya ba'i rgya cher 'grel mdzad de byas par gyur to //
translated: The one who composed the commentary called Stainless Light, which has the meaning of everything, in order to clarify the meaning of the great tantra, was the nirmāṇakāya of Lokeśvara called glorious Pundarīka.

original: gsungs pa yang /🔽rgyas 'grel don kun gsal byed pa //
analyzed: gsungs pa yang / rgyas 'grel don kun gsal byed pa //
translated: It is said:🔽The commentary that clarifies all meanings

original: zhes so // rgya cher 'grel des gsal byas pa'i //
analyzed: zhes so // rgya cher 'grel des gsal byas pa'i //
translated: Is called Stainless Light.

original: sangs rgyas rin chen snying po ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rin chen snying po ste //
translated: The Buddha Ratnagotra

original: yang dag pa'i gdams ngag gi lam snying bo bsod nams las te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i gdams ngag gi lam snying bo bsod nams las te /
translated: The path of the true instruction is the essence of merit.

original: bla ma dam pa'i skabs las thob nas nges pa'i don gyi bdud rtsi bsten pas te /
analyzed: bla ma dam pa'i skabs las thob nas nges pa'i don gyi bdud rtsi bsten pas te /
translated: Having obtained it from the occasion of the holy guru, one should rely on the nectar of the definitive meaning.

original: don dam pa dga' ba bzhi pa'i bdud rtsi thob pas srid pa'i dug ste /
analyzed: don dam pa dga' ba bzhi pa'i bdud rtsi thob pas srid pa'i dug ste /
translated: By obtaining the nectar of the ultimate, the four joys, one cuts off the poison of existence,

original: skye zhing skye ba'i dug chen po gcod par byed cing mchog tu mi 'gyur ba 'dren par byed do //
analyzed: skye zhing skye ba'i dug chen po gcod par byed cing mchog tu mi 'gyur ba 'dren par byed do //
translated: the great poison of birth after birth, and one leads to the supreme, unchanging state.

original: de nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir //
translated: For that very reason,

original: dga' bar byed de rtag tu lhun gyis grub pa'i bde ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' bar byed de rtag tu lhun gyis grub pa'i bde ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it delights, because of the uninterrupted flow of spontaneous bliss.

original: 'dis ni rgya cher 'grel mdzad pa po'i yang ches che ba nyid gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni rgya cher 'grel mdzad pa po'i yang ches che ba nyid gsal bar byed do //
translated: This clarifies the greatness of the author of the commentary.

original: slar @306b yang rgyud kyi lhag pa'i rgyal po'i bdag nyid che ba nyid ston par byed de /
analyzed: slar @306b yang rgyud kyi lhag pa'i rgyal po'i bdag nyid che ba nyid ston par byed de /
translated: Again, it shows the greatness of the nature of the king of tantras.

original: shes bya shes so zhes bya ba'i tshogs rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: shes bya shes so zhes bya ba'i tshogs rnams kyi ste /
translated: It is the knowledge of the knowable, of the collections.

original: phyi dang nang gi rig pa'i gnas kyi tshogs mtha' dag gi gzhi rten te 'byung gnas su'o //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi rig pa'i gnas kyi tshogs mtha' dag gi gzhi rten te 'byung gnas su'o //
translated: The basis, the source, of all the collections of outer and inner sciences.

original: gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is said:

original: dang po'i sangs rgyas su ma gsungs pa gang de /
analyzed: dang po'i sangs rgyas su ma gsungs pa gang de /
translated: That which is not taught as the primordial Buddha

original: med do zhes so //
analyzed: med do zhes so //
translated: does not exist.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po gang du bcom ldan 'das kyi ste /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po gang du bcom ldan 'das kyi ste /
translated: In which king of tantras the Bhagavān,

original: sangs rgyas kyis kun mkhyen gyi mtshan thams cad mkhyen pa zhes pa'i mngon brjod rjes mthun pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis kun mkhyen gyi mtshan thams cad mkhyen pa zhes pa'i mngon brjod rjes mthun pa ste /
translated: the Buddha, is called omniscient, the name of the omniscient one is consistent,

original: don gyi rjes su mthun par gyur pa dang / de kho na nyid rin po che'i 'byung gnas der dbang phyug la sogs pas bshad ba ni rtsva dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: don gyi rjes su mthun par gyur pa dang / de kho na nyid rin po che'i 'byung gnas der dbang phyug la sogs pas bshad ba ni rtsva dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: consistent with the meaning, and in which the explanation by Īśvara and so on is like grass,

original: g-yo bzhin pa nyid kyis na snying po med pa nyid kyi phyir rtsva ra gyur pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo bzhin pa nyid kyis na snying po med pa nyid kyi phyir rtsva ra gyur pa'o //
translated: because it is moving, it is without essence, it is like grass.

original: rgyud gang du shes rab pha rol phyin pa'ang ste chos thams cad stong pa nyid rtogs par byed pa yang ni gang du thal mkha' dag kyang de yin la /
analyzed: rgyud gang du shes rab pha rol phyin pa'ang ste chos thams cad stong pa nyid rtogs par byed pa yang ni gang du thal mkha' dag kyang de yin la /
translated: In which tantra the perfection of wisdom, which causes the realization of the emptiness of all phenomena, is also taught, and in which space is also taught,

original: 'du shes mang por gyur pa gang yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i ljen  pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'du shes mang por gyur pa gang yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i ljen  pa rnams te /
translated: The many perceptions are the naked concepts.

original: de rnams rab tu 'jig byed mchog tu mi 'gyur ba ro mnyam par gyur pa yin pa de ni de skad do //
analyzed: de rnams rab tu 'jig byed mchog tu mi 'gyur ba ro mnyam par gyur pa yin pa de ni de skad do //
translated: The supreme destroyer of those is the state of equal taste of the supreme unchanging.

original: nam mkha' las byung ni sna tshogs gzugs las byung ba'i'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' las byung ni sna tshogs gzugs las byung ba'i'o //
translated: Arisen from space is arisen from the various forms.

original: dag pa'i bdag nyid ni rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag gi mtshan ma med pa'i sku can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dag pa'i bdag nyid ni rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag gi mtshan ma med pa'i sku can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The pure nature is the body that is free from the signs of all concepts.

original: da ni du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan byung ba'i rgyu rnal 'byor yan lag drug gi rten dpal ldan bla mas yang dag par rab tu byin pa'i man ngag gsungs pa dri med ces so //
analyzed: da ni du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan byung ba'i rgyu rnal 'byor yan lag drug gi rten dpal ldan bla mas yang dag par rab tu byin pa'i man ngag gsungs pa dri med ces so //
translated: Now, the cause of the arising of the signs of smoke and so on is the six-branched yoga. The glorious guru, the true giver of the intimate instruction, says:

original: dri ma med pa'i nam mkha' gang la ste /
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i nam mkha' gang la ste /
translated: In stainless space,

original: sprin la sogs pa'i sgrib nga dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: sprin la sogs pa'i sgrib nga dang bral ba'o //
translated: free from the obscurations of clouds and so on.

original: sbrul pa la ste nang la dmigs pa'i bya ba can la'o //
analyzed: sbrul pa la ste nang la dmigs pa'i bya ba can la'o //
translated: In the emanation, which is the object of the inner focus.

original: mig phyed la ste bkab cing ma bkab pa'i mig la'o //
analyzed: mig phyed la ste bkab cing ma bkab pa'i mig la'o //
translated: In the half-closed eyes, which are the eyes that are both closed and open.

original: snying rje chen po rgyas pas brlan cing snum par byed pa'i bsam pa las te /
analyzed: snying rje chen po rgyas pas brlan cing snum par byed pa'i bsam pa las te /
translated: from the intention that is moistened and lubricated by the expansion of great compassion.

original: sems las rten rnam par rtog pa'i sems za zhing rang bzhin med par byed do zhes pa de las so //
analyzed: sems las rten rnam par rtog pa'i sems za zhing rang bzhin med par byed do zhes pa de las so //
translated: From the mind, the basis, the conceptual mind is eaten, and is rendered essenceless.

original: 'dis yang dag par rab tu sbyin pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis yang dag par rab tu sbyin pa gsungs so //
translated: This teaches the correct giving.

original: gsungs pa yang mun pa la cung zad kyang sems pa med par bya'o zhes nye bar bstan pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: gsungs pa yang mun pa la cung zad kyang sems pa med par bya'o zhes nye bar bstan pa'o zhes so //
translated: And it is taught that one should not think about the darkness at all.

original: gzhan du yang /
analyzed: gzhan du yang /
translated: And also elsewhere:

original: yid kyi rtsa ba phyung byas te //
analyzed: yid kyi rtsa ba phyung byas te //
translated: Having pulled out the root of the mind,

original: stong pa nyid la goms byed pa //🔽ma rig @307a * //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la goms byed pa // ma rig @307a * //
translated: and having become accustomed to emptiness,🔽the eye of wisdom will open,🔽and the darkness of ignorance will be destroyed.

original: rab rib kyis ldongs la //
analyzed: rab rib kyis ldongs la //
translated: For those blinded by the cataracts of ignorance,

original: mig sman 'di las gzhan ci yod //
analyzed: mig sman 'di las gzhan ci yod //
translated: what other eye medicine is there but this?

original: ces so // sar ha'i zhabs kyis kyang //
analyzed: ces so // sar ha'i zhabs kyis kyang //
translated: And the venerable Saraha also says:

original: dngos kun mkha' dang mnyam byas shing //
analyzed: dngos kun mkha' dang mnyam byas shing //
translated: Having made all things equal to space,

original: nam mkha' mnyam par sems gzung na //
analyzed: nam mkha' mnyam par sems gzung na //
translated: and having taken hold of the mind that is equal to space,

original: des ni bla med byang chub 'thob //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: des ni bla med byang chub 'thob // ces gsungs so //
translated: one attains the unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: 'dis ni rnam pa kun ldan rnam pa med pa rgyu'o zhes gsungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam pa kun ldan rnam pa med pa rgyu'o zhes gsungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: This teaches that the cause is the possession of all aspects, but without aspects.

original: yod dang med dang gnyis ka dngos po dngos med nges par 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: yod dang med dang gnyis ka dngos po dngos med nges par 'jig pa ste /
translated: Existence, non-existence, both, entity, non-entity, and destruction,

original: yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa mtha' bzhi las rnam par grol ba glo bur ba ste /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa mtha' bzhi las rnam par grol ba glo bur ba ste /
translated: are all liberated from the four extremes, such as existence and non-existence, and so forth.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i sgyu ma la ltos te'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i sgyu ma la ltos te'o //
translated: They are adventitious, in dependence on the illusion of conceptualization.

original: rang gis nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rang gis nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: One will experience it oneself, is the remainder.

original: 'char zhing rab tu skye ste du ba la sogs mtshan ma bcu po ma lus pa gang stong pa nyid kyi rjes 'gro ste 'brel pa can no //
analyzed: 'char zhing rab tu skye ste du ba la sogs mtshan ma bcu po ma lus pa gang stong pa nyid kyi rjes 'gro ste 'brel pa can no //
translated: The arising and complete arising of all ten signs, such as smoke, and so forth, are the followers of emptiness, that is, the related ones.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa gsal bar byed pa rnams ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa gcig nyid du rab tu gsal bar byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa gsal bar byed pa rnams ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa gcig nyid du rab tu gsal bar byed pa rnams so //
translated: The ones that clarify the stage of completion are the clarifiers of the oneness of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: dus gyi  'khor lo'i ye shes kyi le'u'i tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu rtsa drug lhag pa'i brgya pa'i de ma thag pa'i tshigs su bcad pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: dus gyi  'khor lo'i ye shes kyi le'u'i tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu rtsa drug lhag pa'i brgya pa'i de ma thag pa'i tshigs su bcad pas gsungs pa /
translated: The twenty-six verses of the chapter on wisdom of the Kālacakra are clarified by the following verse of the one hundred and eight.🔽It is said:

original: gang phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because of that, and so forth.

original: gang gi phyir 'gyur med las byung ba'i lhan cig skyes pa'i sku la aa phreng dang ka phreng dang / padma dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma'i gdan dang / h'um yig yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan ma las skyes pa'i gzugs dang / kha dag dang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gyur med las byung ba'i lhan cig skyes pa'i sku la aa phreng dang ka phreng dang / padma dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma'i gdan dang / h'um yig yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan ma las skyes pa'i gzugs dang / kha dag dang /
translated: Because of that, the form born from the unchanging simultaneously born body, the seat of the garland of a’s, the garland of ka’s, the lotus, the moon, and the sun, born from the sign of the transformation of the syllable hūṃ, and the pure face and🔽

original: phyag dang dbyibs yongs su brtags pa'i chos bkag pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: phyag dang dbyibs yongs su brtags pa'i chos bkag pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because the Dharma of the examination of the form, the face, the hands, and the shape that arises from the seat of the moon, sun, and lotus, which is produced from the seed syllable, which arises from the sign that is the complete transformation of the garland of vowels and consonants, the seat of the lotus, moon, and sun, and the syllable hūṃ, which arises from the coemergent form that arises from the unchanging, is refuted,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes grub pa gsungs so //🔽aa sogs ni aa yig la sogs pa dbyangs kyi tshogs zla ba ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes grub pa gsungs so // aa sogs ni aa yig la sogs pa dbyangs kyi tshogs zla ba ste /
translated: the Bhagavān taught the perfection of supreme unchanging wisdom.🔽The vowels are the collection of vowels beginning with a, which is the moon.

original: ka sogs ni ka yig la sogs pa gsal byed kyi tshogs nyi ma'o //
analyzed: ka sogs ni ka yig la sogs pa gsal byed kyi tshogs nyi ma'o //
translated: The consonants are the collection of consonants beginning with ka, which is the sun.

original: de dag gcig nyid ni gcig tu byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gcig nyid ni gcig tu byed pa'o //
translated: Their oneness is their unity.

original: gdan ni rten te pa yig gsal byed kyi bdag nyid can padma dang / aa yig gi bdag nyid can zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / re pha'i bdag nyid can nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: gdan ni rten te pa yig gsal byed kyi bdag nyid can padma dang / aa yig gi bdag nyid can zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / re pha'i bdag nyid can nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The seat is the support, which is the lotus that has the nature of the consonant pa, the moon maṇḍala that has the nature of the vowel a, and the sun maṇḍala that has the nature of the consonant ra.

original: rdo rje can gyi ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes can gyi'o //
analyzed: rdo rje can gyi ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes can gyi'o //
translated: The vajra-holder's is the supreme unchanging bliss.

original: ming zhes pa gsal ba'o //
analyzed: ming zhes pa gsal ba'o //
translated: Name is the clear expression.🔽Thus, one should not accept the vajra-sign which is the transformation of the syllable hum, the color of the deity's body which is the transformation of that, the hands and faces which are the configuration of that, and the shape which is the definition of that, because they have the characteristic of change, since they have the characteristic of attachment.🔽The vajra-holder's is the supreme unchanging bliss.

original: de bzhin du h'um yig yongs su gyur pa'i rdo rje'i mtshan ma dang / de yongs su gyur pa'i lha'i sku kha dog dang / phyag dang zhal dang / dbyibs yongs su brtags pa'i chos @307b brten par bya ba'i mtshan nyid can mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du h'um yig yongs su gyur pa'i rdo rje'i mtshan ma dang / de yongs su gyur pa'i lha'i sku kha dog dang / phyag dang zhal dang / dbyibs yongs su brtags pa'i chos @307b brten par bya ba'i mtshan nyid can mi 'dod de /
translated: The vajra-holder's is the supreme unchanging bliss.🔽The vajra-holder's is the supreme unchanging bliss.🔽The vajra-holder's is the supreme unchanging bliss.🔽The vajra-holder's is the supreme unchanging bliss.🔽The vajra-holder's is the supreme unchanging bliss.🔽The vajra-holder's is the supreme unchanging bliss.🔽The vajra-holder's is the supreme unchanging bliss.🔽The vajra-holder's is the supreme unchanging bliss.🔽The vajra-holder's is the supreme unchanging bliss.

original: mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyis na 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyis na 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The vajra-holder's is the supreme unchanging bliss.🔽The vajra-holder's is the supreme unchanging bliss.🔽The vajra-holder's is the supreme unchanging bliss.🔽The vajra-holder's is the supreme unchanging bliss.🔽The vajra-holder's is the supreme unchanging bliss.

original: 'gyur ba med pas te mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde bas bskyed cing de'i phyir yang 'gyur ba mthar byed de 'gyur ba tha mal ba'i skye bos yongs su brtags pa'i aa yig la sogs pa'am mi 'gyur ba dang bral ba'am /
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pas te mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde bas bskyed cing de'i phyir yang 'gyur ba mthar byed de 'gyur ba tha mal ba'i skye bos yongs su brtags pa'i aa yig la sogs pa'am mi 'gyur ba dang bral ba'am /
translated: The vajra-holder's is the supreme unchanging bliss.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa dang bral ba mchog gi dbang po can phyag rgya chen po'i bdag nyid du gyur pa rnam kun pa'i ste 'jig rten gsum gyi rnam pa'i bde ba'i ngo bo can gyi'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa dang bral ba mchog gi dbang po can phyag rgya chen po'i bdag nyid du gyur pa rnam kun pa'i ste 'jig rten gsum gyi rnam pa'i bde ba'i ngo bo can gyi'o //
translated: The supreme organ, free from arising and ceasing, is the nature of the Great Seal.

original: thig le'i ste lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba bzhi pa'i thig le'i'o //
analyzed: thig le'i ste lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba bzhi pa'i thig le'i'o //
translated: The drop is the drop of the fourth joy, the innate joy.

original: rgyal ba'i bdag po mchog gi ste rdo rje sems dpa'i'o //🔽sna tshogs sgyu ma 'dzin pa'i ste /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i bdag po mchog gi ste rdo rje sems dpa'i'o // sna tshogs sgyu ma 'dzin pa'i ste /
translated: The Victorious One is the supreme Victor, Vajrasattva.

original: sna tshogs sgyu ma ni sna tshogs yul phyag rgya chen po ste de 'dzin pa'i'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs sgyu ma ni sna tshogs yul phyag rgya chen po ste de 'dzin pa'i'o //
translated: The various illusions are the various objects, the Great Seal.

original: bla ma dam pa'i man ngag thob pas ni dpal ldan bla ma'i yang dag par rab tu sbyin pa thob pas so //
analyzed: bla ma dam pa'i man ngag thob pas ni dpal ldan bla ma'i yang dag par rab tu sbyin pa thob pas so //
translated: The supreme guru is the glorious guru, from whom one has obtained the perfect gift.

original: gdug pa'i grogs yongs su spang ba ni sdig pa'i grogs po yongs su dor bas so //
analyzed: gdug pa'i grogs yongs su spang ba ni sdig pa'i grogs po yongs su dor bas so //
translated: Abandoning evil friends is abandoning evil companions.

original: du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma bsgom pa ni du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma yongs su sgom pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma bsgom pa ni du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma yongs su sgom pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: The meditation on the signs such as smoke is the meditation on the signs such as smoke.

original: sems brtan par byed pas so //
analyzed: sems brtan par byed pas so //
translated: because it stabilizes the mind.

original: thog mar zhugs pa nyid kyi phyir las dang po pa'o //
analyzed: thog mar zhugs pa nyid kyi phyir las dang po pa'o //
translated: It is for beginners because it is the first entry.

original: sbyangs ba'i dbu ma 'bab pa'i phyir dbu ma rnam par sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyangs ba'i dbu ma 'bab pa'i phyir dbu ma rnam par sbyangs pa'o //
translated: It is the purification of the middle way because it is the descent of the middle way of purification.

original: gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is said:

original: du ba la sogs bsgom bya ste //
analyzed: du ba la sogs bsgom bya ste //
translated: One should cultivate smoke, etc.

original: sems ni g-yo ba med byas nas //
analyzed: sems ni g-yo ba med byas nas //
translated: Having made the mind unmoving,

original: dbu ma sbyang ba byas nas ni //
analyzed: dbu ma sbyang ba byas nas ni //
translated: having purified the middle way,

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur bsgom par bya //
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur bsgom par bya //
translated: one should cultivate the supreme unchanging.

original: zhes so // tshogs khang ni gra ba la sogs pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: zhes so // tshogs khang ni gra ba la sogs pa'i gnas so //
translated: The assembly hall is the place of the lay practitioners, etc.

original: gtsug lag khang ni dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gnas so //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang ni dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gnas so //
translated: The temple is the place of the community of monks.

original: nam mkha'i khams ni sna tshogs gzugs brnyan la rnam pa thams cad pa'i stong pa nyid me long la phra phab pa bzhin du skyes pa med pa'i chos mthong ba ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ni sna tshogs gzugs brnyan la rnam pa thams cad pa'i stong pa nyid me long la phra phab pa bzhin du skyes pa med pa'i chos mthong ba ste /
translated: The element of space is the non-arisen dharma that is seen as the emptiness of all aspects in the various reflections, like a reflection in a mirror.

original: rnam par ma brtags pa'i chos mthong bas so //
analyzed: rnam par ma brtags pa'i chos mthong bas so //
translated: It is the seeing of the dharma that is not imagined.

original: byis pa skye bos brtags pa'i phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir rang gi sems kyi spros pa'i snang brnyan rmi lam dang mtshungs pa'i don du sems pa'o //🔽bye brag tu smra ba dang / mdo sde pa dang rnal 'byor pa'i lugs kyi nang du ma lhung ba'i phyir rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos rnam par dpyad pas stong pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa skye bos brtags pa'i phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir rang gi sems kyi spros pa'i snang brnyan rmi lam dang mtshungs pa'i don du sems pa'o // bye brag tu smra ba dang / mdo sde pa dang rnal 'byor pa'i lugs kyi nang du ma lhung ba'i phyir rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos rnam par dpyad pas stong pa'o //
translated: Because there are no external objects imagined by the childish, it is the meaning of the image of one's own mind, which is like a dream.

original: tshu rol mdzes pa'i lugs @308a * //
analyzed: tshu rol mdzes pa'i lugs @308a * //
translated: Because it does not fall into the systems of the Vaibhāṣikas, Sautrāntikas, and Yogācāras, it is empty of the analysis of phenomena that are the nature of a collection of subtle particles.

original: la mi 'jug pa'i phyir chad par smra ba ring du byas pa nyid kyi phyir na chad pa'i stong pa nyid ring du byas pas so //
analyzed: la mi 'jug pa'i phyir chad par smra ba ring du byas pa nyid kyi phyir na chad pa'i stong pa nyid ring du byas pas so //
translated: Because it does not engage in the system of the Lokāyatas, it is the emptiness of annihilation because it is far from the proponents of annihilation.

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyi bde ba kho na mchog gi phyag rgya'i bde ba ste /
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi bde ba kho na mchog gi phyag rgya'i bde ba ste /
translated: The bliss of the supreme mudra is the inner bliss alone.

original: de nyid rang rig par bya ba'i chos yin zhing de la rjes su chags pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rang rig par bya ba'i chos yin zhing de la rjes su chags pa'o //
translated: That is the dharma to be known by oneself and one should be attached to that.

original: las kyi bud med dang ye shes kyi bud med las byung ba'i bde ba rnams la chags pa med pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi dbang po'i rang rig par bya ba'i chos yongs su spangs pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi bud med dang ye shes kyi bud med las byung ba'i bde ba rnams la chags pa med pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi dbang po'i rang rig par bya ba'i chos yongs su spangs pa'o //
translated: Because of being free from attachment to the bliss arising from the karma mudra and the wisdom mudra, the external objects of the senses are completely abandoned.

original: shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can gyis te /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can gyis te /
translated: By means of the nature of wisdom and means,

original: du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma 'byung ba'i de ma thag tu ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag gsal bar 'byung bar bya ba'i ched du /
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma 'byung ba'i de ma thag tu ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag gsal bar 'byung bar bya ba'i ched du /
translated: immediately after the arising of the signs of smoke and so forth, in order to make the limbs of samadhi arise clearly,

original: legs par bslabs pa'i las kyi phyag rgya la rjes su chags pa'i ro can gyis so //
analyzed: legs par bslabs pa'i las kyi phyag rgya la rjes su chags pa'i ro can gyis so //
translated: by means of the taste of passion for the karma mudra who is well trained.

original: gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is also said:

original: rdo rje padmar bzhag byas nas //
analyzed: rdo rje padmar bzhag byas nas //
translated: Having placed the vajra in the lotus,

original: srog ni thig ler gzhug par bya //
analyzed: srog ni thig ler gzhug par bya //
translated: the life force should be placed in the bindu.

original: 'khor lor thig le thig le rnams //
analyzed: 'khor lor thig le thig le rnams //
translated: In the cakra, the bindus and the bindus

original: g-yo ba rdo rje dgag par bya //
analyzed: g-yo ba rdo rje dgag par bya //
translated: should be stopped by the moving vajra.

original: zhes so // rgyun mi 'chad par phyag rgya chen po la brten pa'i sems kyis yang na'o //
analyzed: zhes so // rgyun mi 'chad par phyag rgya chen po la brten pa'i sems kyis yang na'o //
translated: Again, by means of the mind that is based on the great mudra, without interruption.

original: da ni lam shes pa'i de kho na nyid mi 'thob pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni lam shes pa'i de kho na nyid mi 'thob pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, it is said that the reality of the path is not attained.🔽

original: lam zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lam zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, it is said that the reality of the path-knowledge is not attained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gang gsungs pa'i bzhi'i rab tu dbye ba bcu drug can gyi de kho na nyid bzhi pa dpal ldan bla ma rdo rje de ni rnal 'byor pa ma yin pas 'thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gang gsungs pa'i bzhi'i rab tu dbye ba bcu drug can gyi de kho na nyid bzhi pa dpal ldan bla ma rdo rje de ni rnal 'byor pa ma yin pas 'thob pa ma yin no //
translated: The reality of the four, which has the sixteen divisions, as taught by the Tathagata, is not attained by the non-yogi.

original: sna tshogs rnam rtog ni padma dang nyi ma dang zla ba dang sgra gcan dang dus me dang sa bon dang / mtshan ma yongs su gyur pa'i zhal dang phyag dang / kha dog dang dbyibs dang dpa' bo'i rim pa rang byin gyis brlabs pa'i rigs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs rnam rtog ni padma dang nyi ma dang zla ba dang sgra gcan dang dus me dang sa bon dang / mtshan ma yongs su gyur pa'i zhal dang phyag dang / kha dog dang dbyibs dang dpa' bo'i rim pa rang byin gyis brlabs pa'i rigs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The various conceptualizations are the lotus, sun, moon, Rahu, Kālāgni, seed, and the face, arms, color, shape, and hero stage of the transformation of the sign, the self-consecration stage, and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni chos thams cad chad pa'i stong pa nyid smra ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni chos thams cad chad pa'i stong pa nyid smra ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase and so on includes the teaching of the emptiness of the annihilation of all things, and so on.

original: de kho na nyid 'di rab tu gsal bar dbang bskur gyi le'ur gsungs te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid 'di rab tu gsal bar dbang bskur gyi le'ur gsungs te /
translated: This reality is clearly taught in the Initiation Chapter.

original: 'dod dang dga' ba dag dang 'dar dang 'gyur med kyang ste bzhi pos sbyor ba de gcig ste //
analyzed: 'dod dang dga' ba dag dang 'dar dang 'gyur med kyang ste bzhi pos sbyor ba de gcig ste //
translated: The four joys of desire, delight, trembling, and immobility are one.

original: gang pa dang ni nus dang skye ba mchog tu dga' ba nyid ni gnyis par nges par 'gyur //
analyzed: gang pa dang ni nus dang skye ba mchog tu dga' ba nyid ni gnyis par nges par 'gyur //
translated: The two of power and supreme joy are definitely the second.

original: 'bar dang thig le dang ni gnyid yur slar yang khyad dga'i dga' ba 'di ltar gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'bar dang thig le dang ni gnyid yur slar yang khyad dga'i dga' ba 'di ltar gsum pa'o //
translated: The three of blazing, drop, and falling asleep are the third.

original: aotta dang ni n'a da gnyis dang lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba 'di ltar bzhi par 'gyur //
analyzed: aotta dang ni n'a da gnyis dang lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba 'di ltar bzhi par 'gyur //
translated: The two of o and na da, and innate joy are the fourth.

original: zhes so // de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa li lam gyis de kho na nyid ma yin zhing /
analyzed: zhes so // de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa li lam gyis de kho na nyid ma yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, the reality is not the conceptual process.

original: de @308b kho na nyid ma yin zhes bya yang de kho na nyid kyi sgrub byed du 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de @308b kho na nyid ma yin zhes bya yang de kho na nyid kyi sgrub byed du 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: And even though it is called “not reality,” it is not a proof of reality.

original: gal te 'di de kho na nyid kyi sgrub byed du mi 'gyur ro zhes pa de ci zhen /
analyzed: gal te 'di de kho na nyid kyi sgrub byed du mi 'gyur ro zhes pa de ci zhen /
translated: If it is not a proof of reality, what is it?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / bskyed pa'i rim pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / bskyed pa'i rim pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The stage of generation and so on.

original: de ho na nyid kyi ste bde ba chen po'i sgrub byed de 'di yis bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa sgrub byed de kho na nyid de kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: de ho na nyid kyi ste bde ba chen po'i sgrub byed de 'di yis bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa sgrub byed de kho na nyid de kho na yin gyi /
translated: That is the reality, the means of accomplishing the great bliss, that is to be accomplished by this, the means of accomplishment, that reality, that alone.

original: gzhan padma la sogs pa'i kun du rtog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan padma la sogs pa'i kun du rtog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Other conceptualizations, such as of a lotus, are not.

original: de kho na nyid de ci zhe na /🔽bskyed pa'i rim pa las grol ba ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid de ci zhe na / bskyed pa'i rim pa las grol ba ste /
translated: What is that reality?🔽It is free from the stage of generation,

original: mngal du 'jug pa'i rim pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mngal du 'jug pa'i rim pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: free from the stage of entering the womb.

original: h'um dang phat yid ces sngags so //
analyzed: h'um dang phat yid ces sngags so //
translated: The mind of hum and phat is mantra.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni phyag rgya la sogs pa'i rtog pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni phyag rgya la sogs pa'i rtog pa ste /
translated: The word “etc.” includes the conceptualization of seals, and so on.

original: de dang bral ba ni de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: de dang bral ba ni de kho na nyid do //
translated: Free from that is reality.

original: de ci zhe na gsungs pa /🔽rdzogs pa'i rim /
analyzed: de ci zhe na gsungs pa / rdzogs pa'i rim /
translated: What is that? It is said:🔽The yoga of the stage of completion.

original: pa'i rnal 'byor zhes pa la sogs pa ni grub par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: pa'i rnal 'byor zhes pa la sogs pa ni grub par gyur pa ste /
translated: And so on means that it is accomplished,

original: nam mkha'i sgom pas rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i sgom pas rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: to be realized by the meditation of space.

original: de'i rim pa ni du ba la sogs pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: de'i rim pa ni du ba la sogs pa'i lam ste /
translated: Its stage is the path of smoke, and so on.

original: de'i rnal 'byor ni shes rab kyi gzugs dang lhan cig mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes chen po skye ba la chags pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rnal 'byor ni shes rab kyi gzugs dang lhan cig mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes chen po skye ba la chags pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Its yoga is the attachment to the arising of the great unchanging exalted wisdom together with the form of wisdom.

original: da ni 'phags pa'i tshigs su bshad pa gnyis kyis dpe dang bcas par byang chub kyi sems mthong ba'i thabs ni thabs ma yin ba spangs pas gsungs pa /🔽shing la gnas pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni 'phags pa'i tshigs su bshad pa gnyis kyis dpe dang bcas par byang chub kyi sems mthong ba'i thabs ni thabs ma yin ba spangs pas gsungs pa / shing la gnas pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, with two verses of the Arya, he speaks of the method of seeing the Thought of Enlightenment, together with an example, by avoiding the non-method.🔽It is as follows: Just as fire, not having a support, is not seen, even though it is in the wood, and so on.

original: ji ltar te gang dang 'dra bar me rten med par re zhig mi mthong ba ni shing la gnas kyang zhes pa'i kyang gi sgra'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar te gang dang 'dra bar me rten med par re zhig mi mthong ba ni shing la gnas kyang zhes pa'i kyang gi sgra'i don to //
translated: The word even though has the sense of not having a support.

original: bcad dang dbye ba'i thabs kyis zhas pa byed pa la gsum pa'o //
analyzed: bcad dang dbye ba'i thabs kyis zhas pa byed pa la gsum pa'o //
translated: The word by in by the method of cutting and dividing is the third case, the objective.

original: gcod pa ni sta re la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: gcod pa ni sta re la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: The cutting is by axes and so on.

original: dbye ba ni shing 'byed byed la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: dbye ba ni shing 'byed byed la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: The dividing is by wood-splitters and so on.

original: thabs ni sgo'o //
analyzed: thabs ni sgo'o //
translated: The method is the door.

original: gtsub shing ni srub shig ste de dag gis bsrub pa las so /
analyzed: gtsub shing ni srub shig ste de dag gis bsrub pa las so /
translated: The kindling is the churning stick, and from that means from the churning.

original: me de de la gnas pa yang //
analyzed: me de de la gnas pa yang //
translated: The fire, even though it is in that,

original: zhes pa de la ste bsrub par bya ba'i shing de la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa de la ste bsrub par bya ba'i shing de la gnas pa'o //
translated: That is, it is located in the wood that is to be churned.

original: de bzhin du ste de de dang 'dra bar sems kyi snang ba ni sems snang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du ste de de dang 'dra bar sems kyi snang ba ni sems snang ste /
translated: In the same way, the appearance of mind is the appearance of mind,

original: khams gsum pa mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: khams gsum pa mthong ba yin la /
translated: which is the seeing of the three realms.

original: rnam rtog bsgom pa'i thabs rnams kyis te rnam par rtog pa yang yang du mngon du phyogs par byed pa'i sgo rnams kyis mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam rtog bsgom pa'i thabs rnams kyis te rnam par rtog pa yang yang du mngon du phyogs par byed pa'i sgo rnams kyis mi mthong ngo //
translated: It is not seen by the methods of meditation on conceptual thoughts, by the doors that repeatedly direct the mind toward conceptual thoughts.🔽This is the third case of the agent.

original: 'di ni ste sems kyi snang ba ni brkyang ma dang ro ma gcig tu sbyor bas mthong ste zhes pa byed pa la gsum pa'o //🔽gcig tu sbyor @309a * //
analyzed: 'di ni ste sems kyi snang ba ni brkyang ma dang ro ma gcig tu sbyor bas mthong ste zhes pa byed pa la gsum pa'o // gcig tu sbyor @309a * //
translated: The appearance of mind is seen by the union of the lalanā and rasanā.

original: ba ni gnyis su med par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: ba ni gnyis su med par sbyor ba'o //
translated: Union is the union of nonduality.

original: de nyid du ste rang gi sems kho na la'o //
analyzed: de nyid du ste rang gi sems kho na la'o //
translated: In that very place, in one’s mind only.

original: don dam bsnyen par yang gsungs pa //🔽shing las me dang zla ba chu shel las ni chu yang ce //
