original: thig le che zhes pa rgyu ba dang bcas pa'i mi rgyu ba gsal bar byed pa sngon po zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbyibs su snang ba'o //
analyzed: thig le che zhes pa rgyu ba dang bcas pa'i mi rgyu ba gsal bar byed pa sngon po zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbyibs su snang ba'o //
translated: The great drop is the appearance of the moon, which is blue, illuminating the moving and unmoving, and appearing in the shape of a moon disk.

original: mtshan ma drug po 'di rnams ni sprin med pa'i nam mkha' la lta ba la 'byung ba'i phyir nyin mo'i rnal 'byor dang / bla ga ba med pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma drug po 'di rnams ni sprin med pa'i nam mkha' la lta ba la 'byung ba'i phyir nyin mo'i rnal 'byor dang / bla ga ba med pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: Since these six signs occur in the view of cloudless space, they are the daytime yoga and the yoga without a covering.

original: de nas de'i dbus su son pa mtshan ma med pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i bdag nyid sangs rgyas kyi gzugs mthong ba //
analyzed: de nas de'i dbus su son pa mtshan ma med pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i bdag nyid sangs rgyas kyi gzugs mthong ba //
translated: Then, in the middle of that, one sees the form of the Buddha, the nature of the enjoyment body free of signs.

original: sngon ma can skad cig gcig la lag mthil du gnas pa'i chu ltar shin tu dang pa /
analyzed: sngon ma can skad cig gcig la lag mthil du gnas pa'i chu ltar shin tu dang pa /
translated: Like water on the palm of the hand, it is extremely clear in a single instant.

original: rnam pa thams cad pa bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa mthong ba ni sna tshogs gzugs brnyan 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad pa bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa mthong ba ni sna tshogs gzugs brnyan 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: The vision of all aspects, such as vases and cloth, is the clear light of the various reflections.

original: btsums pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: btsums pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The closing and opening of the eyes is as follows.

original: btsums shing ma btsums mig gis ni bar snang la dmigs pa nyid kyis mig phyed btsums pa dag gis stong pa la gzung 'dzin dang bral pa 'di ni rjes brtags min par rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum du'o //
analyzed: btsums shing ma btsums mig gis ni bar snang la dmigs pa nyid kyis mig phyed btsums pa dag gis stong pa la gzung 'dzin dang bral pa 'di ni rjes brtags min par rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum du'o //
translated: Since the eyes are focused on space, the eyes are half closed. This empty space free of subject and object is the nonconceptual direct perception of the yogin.

original: gzugs de du ba la sogs bsgom par bya ste rang gis nyams su myong bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs de du ba la sogs bsgom par bya ste rang gis nyams su myong bar bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on that form as smoke, etc., and experience it for oneself.

original: rnal 'byor gnyis ka dag kyang dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas kyi rgyud du gsungs te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gnyis ka dag kyang dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas kyi rgyud du gsungs te /
translated: Both kinds of yoga are taught in the glorious Sarvatathāgatātāttvasaṃgraha.

original: nam mkha' kun nas zhen pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' kun nas zhen pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The sky is completely pervaded by the light of the jewel, etc.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par yang gsungs @321b pa ;
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par yang gsungs @321b pa ;
translated: It is also taught in the Prajñāpāramitā:

original: rin chen snang ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rin chen sgron ma zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / zla ba snang ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / nyi ma sgron ma zhes bya ba nas ji srid du rnam pa thams cad mthong ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin no zhes pa la sogs pa'o /
analyzed: rin chen snang ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rin chen sgron ma zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / zla ba snang ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / nyi ma sgron ma zhes bya ba nas ji srid du rnam pa thams cad mthong ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin no zhes pa la sogs pa'o /
translated: The samadhi called “Jewel Light,” the samadhi called “Jewel Lamp,” the samadhi called “Moon Light,” the samadhi called “Sun Lamp,” up to the samadhi called “Seeing All Aspects,” etc.

original: de'i phyir the tshom med pas sangs rgyas nyid don du gnyer bas du ba la sogs pa'i lam bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir the tshom med pas sangs rgyas nyid don du gnyer bas du ba la sogs pa'i lam bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one who is without doubt and who seeks Buddhahood should meditate on the path of smoke, etc.

original: 'o na phyag rgya chen po'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnyog pa mtha' dag gis mtshon pa med pa yin zhing /
analyzed: 'o na phyag rgya chen po'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnyog pa mtha' dag gis mtshon pa med pa yin zhing /
translated: Well, if the Mahāmudrā is not characterized by the complete turbidity of discursive thought,

original: sgom pa yang sgro btags pa yin na bsgom par bya ba zhes brjod pa ji ltar yin zhe na ;
analyzed: sgom pa yang sgro btags pa yin na bsgom par bya ba zhes brjod pa ji ltar yin zhe na ;
translated: and if meditation is a superimposition, how can it be called meditation?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / dngos med ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / dngos med ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The non-entity of entities, etc.

original: man ngag ji lta ba bzhin du phyi dang nang gi dngos med kho na sgom pa /
analyzed: man ngag ji lta ba bzhin du phyi dang nang gi dngos med kho na sgom pa /
translated: Meditation is only the non-entity of the external and internal entities, just as the esoteric instructions.

original: gang gzugs brnyan la rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi sgom pa de ni dngos po med pa nyid kyi phyir sgom pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gzugs brnyan la rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi sgom pa de ni dngos po med pa nyid kyi phyir sgom pa ma yin no //
translated: That meditation of the yogins on the reflection is not meditation because of the non-entity of entities.

original: 'o na dngos po dang dngos po med par sgom pa dag rnam par rtog par khyad par med pa nyid kyi phyir ci ltar dngos po med pa sgom pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dngos po dang dngos po med par sgom pa dag rnam par rtog par khyad par med pa nyid kyi phyir ci ltar dngos po med pa sgom pa yin zhe na /
translated: Well, since the meditation on entity and non-entity are not different in discursiveness, how is it that it is a meditation on non-entity?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / dngos po zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / dngos po zhes pa'o //
translated: The entity of non-entities, etc.

original: gang gi phyir rnal 'byor pa'i stong pa nyid kyi gzugs la dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag med de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnal 'byor pa'i stong pa nyid kyi gzugs la dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag med de /
translated: Because for the yogi, in the form of emptiness, there are no conceptual thoughts of existence and non-existence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: stong pa nyid kyi gzugs la ma brtags pa'i du ba la sogs pa mngon sum mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi gzugs la ma brtags pa'i du ba la sogs pa mngon sum mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the form of emptiness is seen directly, without analysis, like smoke, etc.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning is this:

original: gal te brtags par gyur na de'i tshe dngos por 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te brtags par gyur na de'i tshe dngos por 'gyur te /
translated: If it were analyzed, then at that time it would become an existent,

original: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like a pot, a cloth, etc.

original: gal te mthong ba ma yin par gyur na de'i tshe dngos po med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba ma yin par gyur na de'i tshe dngos po med par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not seen, then at that time it would become a non-existent,

original: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the son of a barren woman, etc.

original: 'dir ni rnam par ma brtags par mngon sum du mthong pa'i phyir thams cad legs par gnas so //
analyzed: 'dir ni rnam par ma brtags par mngon sum du mthong pa'i phyir thams cad legs par gnas so //
translated: Here, because it is seen directly, without analysis, everything is well-established.

original: rnam par ma brtags pa mthong ba grub pa'i don du rjes su mthun pa'i dpe gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par ma brtags pa mthong ba grub pa'i don du rjes su mthun pa'i dpe gsungs te /
translated: In order to establish the seeing of what is not analyzed, a suitable example is stated:

original: pra pha ba ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: pra pha ba ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: prapauca and so on.

original: pra phab pa ni sgrub pa pos bsam ba me long dang ral gri dang mthe bo dang / mar me dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma dang / chu dang / thab dang / mig gi yul can dngos por skyes pa min pa chom rkun la sogs pa bems po'i chos @322a * //
analyzed: pra phab pa ni sgrub pa pos bsam ba me long dang ral gri dang mthe bo dang / mar me dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma dang / chu dang / thab dang / mig gi yul can dngos por skyes pa min pa chom rkun la sogs pa bems po'i chos @322a * //
translated: The divination of the mirror is that the practitioner is not born as an entity with an object of the mirror, sword, thumb, lamp, moon, sun, water, hearth, or eye.

original: su skyes pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: su skyes pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: He is not born as an inanimate thing such as a thief, etc.

original: rnam par ma brtags pa mthong pa 'di la dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag med de /
analyzed: rnam par ma brtags pa mthong pa 'di la dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag med de /
translated: In this seeing, which is not an examination, there is neither entity nor non-entity.

original: dngos po med pa'i don bya ba dang 'bras bu nyid tsam nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i don bya ba dang 'bras bu nyid tsam nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mere meaning of non-entity, which is the effect of the function, is perceived.

original: 'jig rten ba kho na la yang dngos po med pa'i don yang sgyu ma dang rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa la mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten ba kho na la yang dngos po med pa'i don yang sgyu ma dang rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa la mthong ngo //
translated: Even in the world, the meaning of non-entity is seen in such things as illusions, dreams, and magic tricks.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: med pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: med pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The non-existent, etc.”

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ye shes skye ba de yang rnam pa thams cad pa'i 'gro ba'i don phun sum tshogs par byed pa nyid kyi phyir yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ye shes skye ba de yang rnam pa thams cad pa'i 'gro ba'i don phun sum tshogs par byed pa nyid kyi phyir yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu'o //
translated: That nonconceptual intuition which is born is like a wish-granting gem, because it accomplishes the aims of all beings in all modes.

original: dpe 'grub pa gsungs pa /🔽ma mthong ba'i zhes so //🔽sngon ma mthong ba kho na'i chom rkun la sogs pa gnas 'dir sngags kyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i mig gis gzhon nu mas mthong ste pra phab par gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: dpe 'grub pa gsungs pa / ma mthong ba'i zhes so // sngon ma mthong ba kho na'i chom rkun la sogs pa gnas 'dir sngags kyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i mig gis gzhon nu mas mthong ste pra phab par gyur pa na'o //
translated: The establishment of the example is stated:🔽“Not seeing, and seeing, the maiden sees the thieves, etc.”🔽The maiden, by the eye empowered by the mantra, sees the thieves, etc., who have not been seen before, and thus the mirror divination is performed.

original: sgrub pa po pra da bab pa la 'jug pa po rnams kyis ni de dang der gnas gzhon nu mas smras pa nyi tshe ba'i mig gis te sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i mig dag gis mthong ngo //
analyzed: sgrub pa po pra da bab pa la 'jug pa po rnams kyis ni de dang der gnas gzhon nu mas smras pa nyi tshe ba'i mig gis te sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i mig dag gis mthong ngo //
translated: The practitioners who enter into the mirror divination see there by the maiden’s eye, which is limited, i.e., obscured.

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te rnal 'byor pa grub pa'i man ngag gi sngags kyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i blo mig can byang chub kyi sems zla ba ma nyams pas gzhon nu ma bzhin du nye bar ma bstan pa so so skye bo'i rtogs bya ma yin pa
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te rnal 'byor pa grub pa'i man ngag gi sngags kyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i blo mig can byang chub kyi sems zla ba ma nyams pas gzhon nu ma bzhin du nye bar ma bstan pa so so skye bo'i rtogs bya ma yin pa
translated: The idea is this: The yogi who has the eye of the mind blessed by the mantra of the guru’s instruction sees the sky of the supramundane reality, which is not the object of knowledge of ordinary beings,

original: / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i de kho na nyid kyi nam mkha' la mthong ngo //
analyzed: / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i de kho na nyid kyi nam mkha' la mthong ngo //
translated: not being taught by the unblemished moon of the thought of awakening, like a young woman.

original: de yang spros pa thams cad spangs pa'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang spros pa thams cad spangs pa'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: And it is said that it is free from all conceptual elaborations.

original: gzhan gyi mig gis gzhan gyi dus su ma mthong phyir dang / rang gi mig dag gis mun pa dang ras kyis bkag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi mig gis gzhan gyi dus su ma mthong phyir dang / rang gi mig dag gis mun pa dang ras kyis bkag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not seen by the eye of another at another time, and because it is obscured by one’s own eye by darkness and a cloth.

original: pra phab pa'i dpe 'dis rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum rnam pa thams cad du rang bzhin med pa'i phyir skyes pa med pa'i rmi lam du gzhon nu ma'i bu dmigs pa bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes grub bo //
analyzed: pra phab pa'i dpe 'dis rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum rnam pa thams cad du rang bzhin med pa'i phyir skyes pa med pa'i rmi lam du gzhon nu ma'i bu dmigs pa bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes grub bo //
translated: By this example of a divination, the yogi’s perception is established as omniscience, because it is devoid of intrinsic nature in every respect, like the son of a barren woman seen in an insubstantial dream.

original: gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is also said:

original: ji ltar rmi lam na 'dir gzhon nu ma //🔽de yis bu dang skye dang 'chi ba mthong //
analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam na 'dir gzhon nu ma // de yis bu dang skye dang 'chi ba mthong //
translated: Just as here in a dream a young woman🔽sees her son born and dying,

original: skye zhes rga dang shin yid mi bde //
analyzed: skye zhes rga dang shin yid mi bde //
translated: so birth, old age, and death are not real.

original: de bzhin chos rnams thams cad dpes shes bya //
analyzed: de bzhin chos rnams thams cad dpes shes bya //
translated: All phenomena should be understood through this example.

original: zhes so // da ni bde mchog gi rgyud la sogs pa'i rim pas yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor gyi rim pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // da ni bde mchog gi rgyud la sogs pa'i rim pas yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor gyi rim pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the stages of the yoga of the six limbs by the stages of the Cakrasaṃvara Tantra, etc. are stated:

original: rnal 'byor pa nyid @322b ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa nyid @322b ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The yogi/nī, etc.”

original: nyung ngu'i rgyud du gsungs pa yang //
analyzed: nyung ngu'i rgyud du gsungs pa yang //
translated: Also, in the Laghutantra:

original: rnal 'byor pa nyid bsod nams mchog / dag byed sdig pa 'jig byed pa //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa nyid bsod nams mchog / dag byed sdig pa 'jig byed pa //
translated: “The yogi/nī is the supreme merit, the purifier, the destroyer of evil,

original: sngags bzlas pa dang bsam gtan dang // bde ba yis kyang 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: sngags bzlas pa dang bsam gtan dang // bde ba yis kyang 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: and is accomplished by mantra recitation, meditative concentration, and bliss.”

original: zhes so // sngags bzlas pa la sogs pa 'dis dbus ma rim pa ma yin pa zhes pas sngags bzlas pa las sngon du bsam gtan gyi tshig bklag par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes so // sngags bzlas pa la sogs pa 'dis dbus ma rim pa ma yin pa zhes pas sngags bzlas pa las sngon du bsam gtan gyi tshig bklag par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: By this mantra recitation, etc., “the middle is not a stage,” the word “meditative concentration” should be read before “mantra recitation.” This is the meaning.

original: ma brjod pa'i yan lag so sor sdud pa dang / srog rtsol dang / rjes su dran pa gsum mo //
analyzed: ma brjod pa'i yan lag so sor sdud pa dang / srog rtsol dang / rjes su dran pa gsum mo //
translated: The three limbs not mentioned are withdrawal, vitality-stopping, and recollection.

original: 'di zhes pa nyi ma'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes pa nyi ma'o //
translated: Here is the sun.

original: gzhan zhes pa zla pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes pa zla pa'o //
translated: Other is the moon.

original: 'dir zhes pa nyung ngu'i rgyud du'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes pa nyung ngu'i rgyud du'o //
translated: Here is in the short tantra.

original: rgyud gzhan du gsungs pas te dpal 'dus pa'i rgyud du gsungs pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya'o zhes pa 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje'i zhabs kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan du gsungs pas te dpal 'dus pa'i rgyud du gsungs pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya'o zhes pa 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje'i zhabs kyis gsungs so //
translated: The noble Vajrapani said, One should understand by the statements in the other tantras, that is, by the statements in the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra.

original: dpal 'dus pa phyi mar ni le'u bco brgyad par ro //
analyzed: dpal 'dus pa phyi mar ni le'u bco brgyad par ro //
translated: In the second part of the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra, in the eighteenth chapter.

original: ma ning gi bzlas pa ni aa wa dh'u t'i'i de kho na nyid du srog so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ma ning gi bzlas pa ni aa wa dh'u t'i'i de kho na nyid du srog so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: The neuter repetition is the discernment of the life-force in the reality of the avadhuti.

original: rdo rje'i bzlas pa ni don dam pa'i bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i bzlas pa ni don dam pa'i bzlas pa'o //
translated: The vajra repetition is the ultimate repetition.

original: gyen du sna'i rtse mor srog gi rtsol pa'i brtag pa ste sgom pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa ni srog gi rtsol pa 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: gyen du sna'i rtse mor srog gi rtsol pa'i brtag pa ste sgom pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa ni srog gi rtsol pa 'gog pa'o //
translated: The examination, that is, the meditation, of the life-force at the tip of the nose, going upward, is the stopping of the life-force, the perfection of the highest meditation.

original: lte ba las gyen du 'gro zhes ji ltar 'dod par gsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: lte ba las gyen du 'gro zhes ji ltar 'dod par gsal bar bya ste /
translated: One should clarify as desired, going upward from the navel.

original: phyir 'byung ba mi dmigs pa'i mthar thug par ro //
analyzed: phyir 'byung ba mi dmigs pa'i mthar thug par ro //
translated: the exhalation is not perceived, and the end is reached.

original: sna las phyir 'byung ba'i dbugs med par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: sna las phyir 'byung ba'i dbugs med par bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should think that there is no exhalation from the nose.

original: de bzhin kho nar gzhan la mi dmigs pa srid pa ste ji ltar 'dod par sgra yis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin kho nar gzhan la mi dmigs pa srid pa ste ji ltar 'dod par sgra yis rtogs pa'o //
translated: Just so, in the case of the others, non-perception is possible, and one understands it as one wishes.

original: gzhan ni sbas pa'i man ngag go //
analyzed: gzhan ni sbas pa'i man ngag go //
translated: The other is the esoteric instruction.

original: de bzhin zhes pa'o //🔽sngags bzlas pas zhes pa la so sor sdud pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes pa'o // sngags bzlas pas zhes pa la so sor sdud pa ni /
translated: Just so.

original: aom yig la sogs pa brjod pa de'i ming can gyis so //
analyzed: aom yig la sogs pa brjod pa de'i ming can gyis so //
translated: By the recitation of the mantra, means by the one who has the name of the utterance of the syllable Om, etc.

original: lha'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyi sogs pa'i sgras lha'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: lha'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyi sogs pa'i sgras lha'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The divine eye, etc., the word etc. includes the divine ear, etc.

original: dbugs 'jug pa ni rab tu 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid can no ;
analyzed: dbugs 'jug pa ni rab tu 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid can no ;
translated: The inhalation is characterized by the entry.

original: /'gog pa ni brtan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: /'gog pa ni brtan par gyur pa'o //
translated: The cessation is the stability.

original: dbugs 'byung ba na phyir 'byung ba'i ngo bo ste don 'di ni rang gi nyams su myong bas grub pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba na phyir 'byung ba'i ngo bo ste don 'di ni rang gi nyams su myong bas grub pa'o //
translated: The exhalation is the nature of the exit. This meaning is established by one's own experience.

original: nges pa'i don ni phyag na rdo rje'i zhabs la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' chen pos yang dag par bzhed pa ste log par rtogs pa'i yul @323a * //
analyzed: nges pa'i don ni phyag na rdo rje'i zhabs la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' chen pos yang dag par bzhed pa ste log par rtogs pa'i yul @323a * //
translated: The definitive meaning is what is accepted by the great bodhisattvas such as Vajrapāṇi.🔽

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: The definitive meaning is what is accepted by the great bodhisattvas such as Vajrapāṇi, not the domain of wrong understanding.

original: gzhan du rnam pa gzhan pa ni dgos pa gzhan gyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: gzhan du rnam pa gzhan pa ni dgos pa gzhan gyi dbang gis so //
translated: Otherwise, the other aspects are due to the power of other purposes.

original: rang gi 'dod pa'i lha mthong pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i gtum mo mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pa'i lha mthong pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i gtum mo mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: Seeing one’s desired deity is the actualization of nonconceptual caṇḍālī.

original: dgongs pa'i skad gzhan gyi zhes pa //
analyzed: dgongs pa'i skad gzhan gyi zhes pa //
translated: The other language of intention

original: khyad 'phags 'dod pa'i sems can la //
analyzed: khyad 'phags 'dod pa'i sems can la //
translated: is for the special, desirous sentient beings.

original: 'gal ba brjod pa'i tshul gyis ni //
analyzed: 'gal ba brjod pa'i tshul gyis ni //
translated: By the method of speaking in contradiction,

original: chos kyi de nyid rab gsal byed //
analyzed: chos kyi de nyid rab gsal byed //
translated: the reality of the dharma is clarified.

original: gang de dgongs pa'i ched du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang de dgongs pa'i ched du gsungs pa'o //
translated: That is what is taught for the purpose of intention.

original: zhes bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis so //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis so //
translated: It has the characteristic that was explained.

original: gang gi phyir rgyud ni mtha' drug pa'i mtshan nyid can du gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyud ni mtha' drug pa'i mtshan nyid can du gsungs te /
translated: Because the tantra is taught to have the characteristic of the six limits.

original: de skad du yang dpal 'dus par //
analyzed: de skad du yang dpal 'dus par //
translated: Thus it is said in the Śrī Guhyasamāja:

original: dgongs pa'i skad dang skad min dang // drang pa'i don dang nges don dang ; / ji bzhin sgra dang sgra bzhin min //
analyzed: dgongs pa'i skad dang skad min dang // drang pa'i don dang nges don dang ; / ji bzhin sgra dang sgra bzhin min //
translated: The literal meaning and the non-literal meaning,

original: mtha' drug ces par bsgrags pa yin //
analyzed: mtha' drug ces par bsgrags pa yin //
translated: These are proclaimed as the six parameters.

original: khyad 'phags 'dod pa'i sems can la //
analyzed: khyad 'phags 'dod pa'i sems can la //
translated: For sentient beings who desire the superior,

original: 'gal pa brjod pa'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: 'gal pa brjod pa'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the application of expressing contradictions,

original: chos kyi de nyid gsal byed pa //
analyzed: chos kyi de nyid gsal byed pa //
translated: That which clarifies the thatness of phenomena

original: gang de dgongs pas gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang de dgongs pas gsungs pa'o //
translated: Is taught with an intention.

original: dbang po rtul po'i sems can rnams //
analyzed: dbang po rtul po'i sems can rnams //
translated: For sentient beings with dull faculties,

original: rtogs pa'i don du cher gsal ba //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i don du cher gsal ba //
translated: For the sake of realization, it is greatly clarified.

original: dgongs pa min par yang dag bshad //
analyzed: dgongs pa min par yang dag bshad //
translated: It is explained as non-intentional.🔽The realization of mandalas and so forth,

original: dkyil 'khor la sogs rtogs pa dang // spyod pa ji lta ji lta bar //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la sogs rtogs pa dang // spyod pa ji lta ji lta bar //
translated: And the conduct, just as it is,

original: rgyas pa'i don ni rjod byed pa //
analyzed: rgyas pa'i don ni rjod byed pa //
translated: Expresses the meaning of expansion.

original: de ni ji bzhin skra ru bshad //
analyzed: de ni ji bzhin skra ru bshad //
translated: That is explained as the literal meaning.

original: ko t'a ksha la sogs pa'i sgra //
analyzed: ko t'a ksha la sogs pa'i sgra //
translated: Sounds like koṭākṣa and so forth,

original: 'jig rten bstan bcos phyi rol byas //
analyzed: 'jig rten bstan bcos phyi rol byas //
translated: Are made into external treatises by the world.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas brdar byas pa //🔽de ni ji bzhin sgra min bsgrags //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas brdar byas pa // de ni ji bzhin sgra min bsgrags //
translated: What is symbolically created by the Tathāgata🔽Is proclaimed as the non-literal meaning.

original: sbas te nge nyid gsungs pa ni //
analyzed: sbas te nge nyid gsungs pa ni //
translated: The teaching of thatness in a hidden manner

original: rgyal bas drang ba'i don du gsungs //
analyzed: rgyal bas drang ba'i don du gsungs //
translated: The Victorious One taught them with an implied meaning.

original: yang dag don ni gsal ched du //
analyzed: yang dag don ni gsal ched du //
translated: In order to clarify the ultimate meaning,

original: nges pa'i don yang bshad pa yin //
analyzed: nges pa'i don yang bshad pa yin //
translated: I have explained the definitive meaning.

original: zhes so // gtsug tor gyi gzugs ni sangs rgyas gyi  gzugs so //
analyzed: zhes so // gtsug tor gyi gzugs ni sangs rgyas gyi  gzugs so //
translated: The form of the crown is the form of the Buddha.

original: khams gsum pa zhes pa ni thig le chen po'i dbus su ri mo nag po la so sor snang ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i bdag nyid 'jig rten gsum mthong ba'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa zhes pa ni thig le chen po'i dbus su ri mo nag po la so sor snang ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i bdag nyid 'jig rten gsum mthong ba'o //
translated: The three realms are the three worlds seen in the center of the great drop, in the black line, with the nature of the enjoyment body, with various aspects.

original: bsam pa thams cad ces pa gang cung zad rtog pas sems par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa thams cad ces pa gang cung zad rtog pas sems par byed pa'o //
translated: All thoughts are whatever is thought by the imagination.

original: rten med pa ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rten med pa ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: Without support is without reference.

original: smig rgyu ni mchan ma gnyis pa'o zhes pa rgyud gzhan du ;
analyzed: smig rgyu ni mchan ma gnyis pa'o zhes pa rgyud gzhan du ;
translated: The mirage is the second sign, as it is said in another tantra.

original: dang por smig rgyu lta bu ste //
analyzed: dang por smig rgyu lta bu ste //
translated: First, like a mirage,

original: zhes pa lugs las bzlog pa rtogs par bya'o zhes pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: zhes pa lugs las bzlog pa rtogs par bya'o zhes pa'i bar ro //
translated: up to “should be understood in reverse order” should be understood.

original: 'di yang bla ma dam pas nye bar bstan pa las dang / byang chub sems dpas mdzad pa'i rgya cher 'grel las dang / rang gi nyams su myong ba las kyang rnam par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di yang bla ma dam pas nye bar bstan pa las dang / byang chub sems dpas mdzad pa'i rgya cher 'grel las dang / rang gi nyams su myong ba las kyang rnam par shes par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood from the teaching of the holy guru, from the commentary composed by the Bodhisattvas, and from one's own experience.

original: shes rab @323b dang thabs kyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: shes rab @323b dang thabs kyi dbye bas so //
translated: It is by the division of wisdom and means.

original: gtso bor khams lnga rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo mtshan ma lnga rnams dpal gsang ba 'dus pa la sogs par rab tu rtogs par mdzad de /
analyzed: gtso bor khams lnga rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo mtshan ma lnga rnams dpal gsang ba 'dus pa la sogs par rab tu rtogs par mdzad de /
translated: The five signs, which are the essence of the purification of the five elements, are well known in the Shri Guhyasamaja and so forth.

original: nam mkha'i khams kyang der gsungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyang der gsungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The element of space is also mentioned there.

original: le'u bco brgyad par gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: le'u bco brgyad par gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is also said in the eighteenth chapter:

original: chu dang me dang rlung dang sa /
analyzed: chu dang me dang rlung dang sa /
translated: Water, fire, wind, earth,🔽and space, all of them

original: nam mkha' de rnams thabs cad ni //
analyzed: nam mkha' de rnams thabs cad ni //
translated: are perceived as

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang 'dra bar //🔽rnam par dmigs bzhin pa yin no //🔽zhes so // sa chu la thim pa las smig rgyu'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang 'dra bar // rnam par dmigs bzhin pa yin no // zhes so // sa chu la thim pa las smig rgyu'i rnam pa'o //
translated: like the Bodhisattvas.🔽Earth dissolving into water is the mirage appearance.

original: chu me la thim pa las du ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: chu me la thim pa las du ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Water dissolving into fire is the smoke appearance.

original: me rlung la thim pa las mkha' snang gi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: me rlung la thim pa las mkha' snang gi rnam pa'o //
translated: The appearance of fire dissolves into the wind, and the appearance of the sky arises.

original: phra mo'i khams kyi snang ba gsum nam mkha' la sgron ma dang 'dra par snang ba'i phung po'i chos nyid kyi phyir sgron ma'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: phra mo'i khams kyi snang ba gsum nam mkha' la sgron ma dang 'dra par snang ba'i phung po'i chos nyid kyi phyir sgron ma'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The three appearances of the subtle element appear like a lamp in the sky, and because of the nature of the aggregate of phenomena, they are the appearance of a lamp.

original: rang bzhin gyi snang ba nub pa las sprin med pa'i nam mkha' dang 'dra ba rtag tu snang ba'i ngo bo nyid ni sprin med pa'i nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'o zhes pa'i mtshan ma lnga rnams so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi snang ba nub pa las sprin med pa'i nam mkha' dang 'dra ba rtag tu snang ba'i ngo bo nyid ni sprin med pa'i nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'o zhes pa'i mtshan ma lnga rnams so //
translated: The appearance of the nature dissolves, and the appearance of the sky, which is like a cloudless sky, is the nature of always appearing, which is similar to a cloudless sky. These are the five signs.

original: gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is also said:

original: dang pos ni chu la 'gro //
analyzed: dang pos ni chu la 'gro //
translated: The first moves in the water.

original: chu ni gtsang byed rlung la rjes su 'gro //
analyzed: chu ni gtsang byed rlung la rjes su 'gro //
translated: The water moves in the purifying wind.

original: rnam par shes la rlung 'jug byed //
analyzed: rnam par shes la rlung 'jug byed //
translated: The wind moves in the consciousness.

original: rnam shes 'dzin pa'i yan lag nyid //
analyzed: rnam shes 'dzin pa'i yan lag nyid //
translated: The consciousness is the branch of grasping.

original: de nas 'od gsal ba la 'jug / ces so //
analyzed: de nas 'od gsal ba la 'jug / ces so //
translated: Then one enters into the clear light.

original: sgyu 'phrul dra bar nyin mo'i rnal 'byor gyis phung po drug rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo'i mtshan ma drug rnams nam mkha' las byung zhes pa la sogs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra bar nyin mo'i rnal 'byor gyis phung po drug rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo'i mtshan ma drug rnams nam mkha' las byung zhes pa la sogs pas gsungs so //
translated: In the Web of Magic, the yoga of the day is stated to be the six signs, which are the essence of the purification of the six aggregates, “arising from space,” and so on.

original: dpal ldan dang po'i sangs rgyas rgyud kyi lhag pa'i rgyal po ru ni yul dang dbang po shes rab dang thabs rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo'i mtshan ma bcu rnams gtso bor rtogs par mdzad do //
analyzed: dpal ldan dang po'i sangs rgyas rgyud kyi lhag pa'i rgyal po ru ni yul dang dbang po shes rab dang thabs rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo'i mtshan ma bcu rnams gtso bor rtogs par mdzad do //
translated: In the glorious King of Glorious Yoga Tantras, the ten signs, which are the essence of the purification of the sense organs, sense objects, wisdom, and means, are mainly to be realized.

original: byed pa 'di rnams kyis zhes pa lha'i mig la sogs pa rnams kyis so sor sdud pa'i yan lag thob pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: byed pa 'di rnams kyis zhes pa lha'i mig la sogs pa rnams kyis so sor sdud pa'i yan lag thob pa rnams kyis so //
translated: “ By these activities” means by the branches of withdrawal, which are the divine eye and so on.

original: bcing pa'i sbyor bas ni srog 'ching ba'i rgyud nyid kyi phyir srog rtsol gyi ngo bo rnams kyis so //
analyzed: bcing pa'i sbyor bas ni srog 'ching ba'i rgyud nyid kyi phyir srog rtsol gyi ngo bo rnams kyis so //
translated: “ By the practice of binding” means by the essence of life-energy control, because it is the continuum of the binding of life.

original: de nyid ni so sor sdud pa'i zhes dgongs pa ste rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa'i mngon sum nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni so sor sdud pa'i zhes dgongs pa ste rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa'i mngon sum nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That is the withdrawal, because it is direct perception free from conceptuality and error.

original: gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is also said:

original: dbang po bcu po rnams kyi ni //🔽rang gi 'jug gnas thams cad nas //
analyzed: dbang po bcu po rnams kyi ni // rang gi 'jug gnas thams cad nas //
translated: The ten faculties

original: 'dod pa phyi phyir sdud pa ni //
analyzed: 'dod pa phyi phyir sdud pa ni //
translated: are withdrawn from all their own engagements and locations,🔽and are repeatedly drawn in.

original: so sor sdud pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: so sor sdud pa zhes brjod do //
translated: This is called “withdrawal.”

original: zhes so // 'di'i so sor rgyas par bshad pa nam dbang po rnams dang dbang po'i don rnams kyang ste /
analyzed: zhes so // 'di'i so sor rgyas par bshad pa nam dbang po rnams dang dbang po'i don rnams kyang ste /
translated: The individual explanations of this are as follows. The faculties and the objects of the faculties

original: de rnams kyi rang gi 'jug pa ni rang nyid ji lta bar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bos 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang gi 'jug pa ni rang nyid ji lta bar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bos 'jug pa ste /
translated: are engaged by their own nature as the essences of apprehender and apprehended.

original: der gnas @324a * //
analyzed: der gnas @324a * //
translated: Abiding in that

original: pa ni rang 'jug gnas so //
analyzed: pa ni rang 'jug gnas so //
translated: is the engagement and abiding of each.

original: thams cad nas ni dman pa dang bar ma dang mchog gi dbye bas so //
analyzed: thams cad nas ni dman pa dang bar ma dang mchog gi dbye bas so //
translated: All of them are divided into inferior, middling, and superior.

original: 'dod pa phyi phyir sdud pa ni 'dod par bya zhing mngon par 'dod par bya'o zhes pa 'dod pa rnams te gzugs la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa phyi phyir sdud pa ni 'dod par bya zhing mngon par 'dod par bya'o zhes pa 'dod pa rnams te gzugs la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The objects are forms and so on.

original: de rnams dbang po rnams kyis gang du sdud pa ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams dbang po rnams kyis gang du sdud pa ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: They are drawn in by the faculties, which means that they are apprehended.

original: phyi phyir ni yang dang yang du'o //
analyzed: phyi phyir ni yang dang yang du'o //
translated: Repeatedly means again and again.

original: de so sor sdud pa'o zhes pa yan lag dang po'i so sor rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de so sor sdud pa'o zhes pa yan lag dang po'i so sor rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the first branch of yoga.

original: so sor sdud pa brjod pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gang mthong ba gsal bar byas pa de ni dngos po ma yin zhing dngos po med pa ma yin la /
analyzed: so sor sdud pa brjod pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gang mthong ba gsal bar byas pa de ni dngos po ma yin zhing dngos po med pa ma yin la /
translated: What is seen by the one who has the characteristic of the description of withdrawal is not a thing, nor is it a non-thing.

original: brtags pa'i ngo po ma yin te ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: brtags pa'i ngo po ma yin te ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: It is not an imagined nature. Why is that?🔽Because the one-pointed mind without discursive thought sees things of the past, future, and present without conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i sems rtse gcig pa nyid la ma brtags par 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dngos po mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes pa bsam gtan gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i sems rtse gcig pa nyid la ma brtags par 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dngos po mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes pa bsam gtan gyi yan lag go //
translated: This is the branch of meditation.

original: gsungs pa yang //
analyzed: gsungs pa yang //
translated: It is also said:

original: 'dod pa lnga rnams bsdus pa yis //
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga rnams bsdus pa yis //
translated: By the inclusion of the five desires,

original: sangs rgyas lnga dang rab sbyor las //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga dang rab sbyor las //
translated: from the union with the five buddhas,

original: rtog byed bsam gtan zhes brjod de //
analyzed: rtog byed bsam gtan zhes brjod de //
translated: meditation is called conceptual.

original: bsam gtan de ni rnam lngar 'gyur //
analyzed: bsam gtan de ni rnam lngar 'gyur //
translated: That meditation becomes fivefold.🔽Discursive thought, analysis,

original: rtog pa dang ni dpyod pa dang // dga' ba nyid dang de bzhin bde //
analyzed: rtog pa dang ni dpyod pa dang // dga' ba nyid dang de bzhin bde //
translated: joy, and likewise bliss,

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang lnga //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang lnga //
translated: and one-pointedness of mind are the five.

original: de rnams bsam gtan bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams bsam gtan bsdus pa'o //
translated: These are the summary of the meditative stabilizations.

original: gsang ba gsum ni rtog pa ste //
analyzed: gsang ba gsum ni rtog pa ste //
translated: The three secrets are the concepts.

original: de la longs spyod dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: de la longs spyod dpyod pa'o //
translated: The enjoyment is the analysis of those.

original: dga' ba 'dra ba gsum pa ste //
analyzed: dga' ba 'dra ba gsum pa ste //
translated: The third is similar to joy.

original: bde ba bsdus pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba bsdus pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the summary of bliss.

original: shes pa shes bya la 'byung zad //
analyzed: shes pa shes bya la 'byung zad //
translated: The knowledge arises from the object of knowledge.

original: rang sems lnga par shes par bya //
analyzed: rang sems lnga par shes par bya //
translated: One should know the fifth as one’s own mind.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin zhi //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin zhi //
translated: The nature of all buddhas is peace.

original: rnam pa thams cad so sor gnas //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad so sor gnas //
translated: All aspects are individually present.

original: zhes so // so sor sdud pa rnam par sbyang ba'i ched du yan lag gnyis pa so sor rgyas par bshad de //
analyzed: zhes so // so sor sdud pa rnam par sbyang ba'i ched du yan lag gnyis pa so sor rgyas par bshad de //
translated: The second branch is explained in detail for the purpose of purifying the individual withdrawal.

original: 'dod pa lnga ni gzugs la sogs pa dbang po rnams kyi yul du gyur pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga ni gzugs la sogs pa dbang po rnams kyi yul du gyur pa rnams so //
translated: The five objects are form and so on, which are the objects of the sense faculties.

original: bsdus pa yis ni dbang po rnams dang gcig tu gyur pas so //
analyzed: bsdus pa yis ni dbang po rnams dang gcig tu gyur pas so //
translated: They are withdrawn because they become one with the sense faculties.

original: bsam gtan lnga ni mig la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: bsam gtan lnga ni mig la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: The five meditative stabilizations are the eyes and so on.

original: de rnams kyi sbyor ba ni bskul ba ste sangs rgyas lnga'i rab sbyor las so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sbyor ba ni bskul ba ste sangs rgyas lnga'i rab sbyor las so //
translated: Their application is the urging, from the yoga of the five buddhas.

original: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang sangs rgyas lnga rnams so zhes pa'i rnam pa 'di ltar gang yongs su rtog pa des bsam gtan no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang sangs rgyas lnga rnams so zhes pa'i rnam pa 'di ltar gang yongs su rtog pa des bsam gtan no //
translated: Therefore, one should contemplate the form and so on as the five Buddhas.

original: de yang rtog pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa lngar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang rtog pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa lngar 'gyur te /
translated: That is also of five kinds, according to the division into imagination and so on.

original: rtog pa la sogs pas rab tu dbye ba bshad de //
analyzed: rtog pa la sogs pas rab tu dbye ba bshad de //
translated: The imagination and so on are explained as follows:

original: gsang ba gsum zhes pa la sogs pa la dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams ni gsang ba gsum mo //
analyzed: gsang ba gsum zhes pa la sogs pa la dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams ni gsang ba gsum mo //
translated: The three mysteries are the sense organs, sense objects, and sense consciousnesses.🔽The five sense organs, the sense consciousnesses, and their objects are all of the nature of the five Tathagatas.

original: dbang po lnga rnams dang dbang po rnam par shes pa rnams dang @324b de'i yul rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid rnams so zhes gang yongs su shes pa de ni rtog pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po lnga rnams dang dbang po rnam par shes pa rnams dang @324b de'i yul rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid rnams so zhes gang yongs su shes pa de ni rtog pa'o //
translated: That is imagination.

original: de nyid la gang rnam par dpyod par byed cing de kho na nyid la 'jug pa la mngon du phyogs pas gang yid bde ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid can de'i dga' ba dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid la gang rnam par dpyod par byed cing de kho na nyid la 'jug pa la mngon du phyogs pas gang yid bde ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid can de'i dga' ba dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: That is joy, which is similar to the joy of one who is engaged in the investigation of reality, who is intent on entering into reality, and who is characterized by mental satisfaction.

original: de kho na nyid la mngon par zhugs pas lus shin tu sbyangs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid thob pa'i bde ba gang yin pa de ni bde ba sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la mngon par zhugs pas lus shin tu sbyangs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid thob pa'i bde ba gang yin pa de ni bde ba sdud pa'o //
translated: The pleasure which is obtained through the attainment of the characteristics of physical and mental pliancy, etc. by entering into reality is the pleasure of collecting.

original: de ltar goms pa las rab kyi mthar thug par 'gro ba'i phyir shes pa yi ste mig la sogs pa'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug gi shes bya la ste /
analyzed: de ltar goms pa las rab kyi mthar thug par 'gro ba'i phyir shes pa yi ste mig la sogs pa'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug gi shes bya la ste /
translated: From the practice of that, the arising of the consciousness of the six sense consciousnesses, such as the eye consciousness, etc. in the objects of consciousness,

original: gzugs la sogs pa chos kyi khams kyi mthar thug pa la 'byung ba ni shes pa shes bya las 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa chos kyi khams kyi mthar thug pa la 'byung ba ni shes pa shes bya las 'byung ste /
translated: up to the ultimate object, the element of dharmas, is the arising of consciousness from the object of consciousness.

original: de zad pa ni sems kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ste stong pa nyid yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid can sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni rang gi sems zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de zad pa ni sems kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ste stong pa nyid yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid can sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni rang gi sems zhes brjod do //
translated: The exhaustion of that, the one-pointed mind which has the characteristic of the thorough knowledge of emptiness, the non-apprehension of subject and object, is called one’s own mind.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i sems de ni sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin zhi ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i sems de ni sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin zhi ba ste /
translated: That mind of such a kind is the nature of all the buddhas, peace.

original: snang ba tsam thams cad stong pa nyid du gcig pa'i mthar thug pa skye'o zhes pa yan lag gnyis pa'i rab tu dbye ba rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: snang ba tsam thams cad stong pa nyid du gcig pa'i mthar thug pa skye'o zhes pa yan lag gnyis pa'i rab tu dbye ba rnam pa lnga'o //

original: nam mkha' la mtshan mo'i rnal 'byor gyis te bla gab med pa la zhes pa nyin mo'i rnal 'byor gyis so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la mtshan mo'i rnal 'byor gyis te bla gab med pa la zhes pa nyin mo'i rnal 'byor gyis so //

analyzed: bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi ming can zhes pa la sogs pas yan lag gsum pa srog rtsol brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: gsungs pa yang /

analyzed: rin chen chen po kha dog lnga //

original: da ci zhe na /

analyzed: gsungs pa yang /
translated: it is said:

analyzed: slong mo za zhing bzlas bya min //

original: slong 'byung dga' bar 'gyur ba'ang yin //
analyzed: slong 'byung dga' bar 'gyur ba'ang yin //

original: sngags kyi yan lag dbyer med bzlas //

analyzed: 'dod pa kun la longs spyod pas //

analyzed: so sor sdud pa la nye bar dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
