analyzed: slong byung ni brda las gyur pa ste sngags kyi de kho na nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The beggar is the one arisen from the sign, and is called the reality of mantra.

original: sngags 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldan pa la so sor rtog pa'i bdag nyid can te yan lag dbyer med ni de bzhin nyid don dam pa dbu ma dbyer med pa'i yan lag nyid do //
analyzed: sngags 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldan pa la so sor rtog pa'i bdag nyid can te yan lag dbyer med ni de bzhin nyid don dam pa dbu ma dbyer med pa'i yan lag nyid do //
translated: The one endowed with the entry and abiding of mantra is of the nature of discernment, and the indivisible branch is the reality of suchness, the ultimate, the indivisible middle.

original: rjes su dran pa bsgrub par brjod par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dran pa bsgrub par brjod par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of recollection should be stated.

original: gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is also said:

original: brtan pa rdo rje'i lam gyis ni //
analyzed: brtan pa rdo rje'i lam gyis ni //
translated: By the path of the vajra of stability,

original: nam mkha'i khams su spro byed pa //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams su spro byed pa //
translated: one should emanate into the realm of space.

original: rjes su dran pas bsgoms nas gang //
analyzed: rjes su dran pas bsgoms nas gang //
translated: Having meditated with recollection,

original: de yi rnam par spro bar bya //
analyzed: de yi rnam par spro bar bya //
translated: one should emanate its aspects.

original: zhes so // rdo rje'i lam gyis te 'gom par bya ba min pa mtshan ma lnga'i rim pas 'od gsal ba la rab tu zhugs pas brtan pa rnam par dag pa'i sems ni nam mkha'i khams su ste 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su spro bar bya ste chos kyi sku'i ngo
analyzed: zhes so // rdo rje'i lam gyis te 'gom par bya ba min pa mtshan ma lnga'i rim pas 'od gsal ba la rab tu zhugs pas brtan pa rnam par dag pa'i sems ni nam mkha'i khams su ste 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su spro bar bya ste chos kyi sku'i ngo
translated: By the vajra path, by the process of the five signs which are not to be traversed, having entered into clear light, the mind of pure stability should be emanated into the realm of space, into the world realms, by means of the nature of the Dharma body.

original: bos so // de ltar bdag nyid 'od gsal bar gyur pa bsgoms shing mngon du byas nas gang sngar rjes su dran pas smig rgyu la sogs pa'i rnam pas yang dag pa'i mtha' thob par gyur pa de'i rnam pa ste rim pa de kho nas yang dag par spro bar bya'o
analyzed: bos so // de ltar bdag nyid 'od gsal bar gyur pa bsgoms shing mngon du byas nas gang sngar rjes su dran pas smig rgyu la sogs pa'i rnam pas yang dag pa'i mtha' thob par gyur pa de'i rnam pa ste rim pa de kho nas yang dag par spro bar bya'o
translated: Thus, having meditated and actualized oneself as clear light, then by the very process by which one previously attained the limit of reality by means of the aspects of mirage and so forth, one should emanate the very same process.

original: // de ma thag tu brjod pa 'di ni yan lag lnga pa rjes su dran pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: // de ma thag tu brjod pa 'di ni yan lag lnga pa rjes su dran pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: This just explained is the fifth branch, recollection.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i ngo bo can gyi gnas skabs de'i ni byang chub sems @325b dpa' rnams kyi stong nyid byang chub tu brjod par bya'o zhes pa'i mthar thug pas ting nge 'dzin gsungs so //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i ngo bo can gyi gnas skabs de'i ni byang chub sems @325b dpa' rnams kyi stong nyid byang chub tu brjod par bya'o zhes pa'i mthar thug pas ting nge 'dzin gsungs so //
translated: This is the ultimate, and it is taught as the samādhi.

original: gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is said:

original: shes rab thabs ni snyoms 'jug pas //
analyzed: shes rab thabs ni snyoms 'jug pas //
translated: Through the union of wisdom and method,

original: dngos po thams cad bsdus pa las //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad bsdus pa las //
translated: all things are gathered.

original: bsdus te gong bu'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: bsdus te gong bu'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: Through the yoga of gathering into a ball,

original: gzugs brnyan dbus su bsgom par bya ;
analyzed: gzugs brnyan dbus su bsgom par bya ;
translated: the reflection is meditated in the center.

original: / yud kyis ye shes rdzogs pa ni //
analyzed: / yud kyis ye shes rdzogs pa ni //
translated: The perfection of gnosis in an instant

original: ting 'dzin zhes pa'i ming can no //
analyzed: ting 'dzin zhes pa'i ming can no //
translated: is called “samādhi.”

original: zhes so // dngos po thams cad ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: zhes so // dngos po thams cad ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba'o //
translated: All things are the animate and inanimate.

original: shes rab dang thabs snyoms par 'jug pas ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i sbyor bas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs snyoms par 'jug pas ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i sbyor bas gnas pa'o //
translated: Through the union of wisdom and method, they abide through the union of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: gong bu'i gzugs kyis ni phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs kyis gcig tu byas nas so //
analyzed: gong bu'i gzugs kyis ni phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs kyis gcig tu byas nas so //
translated: Through the form of the ball, they are made one through the form of the great seal.

original: brtan pa dang g-yo ba de'i dbus su zung 'jug gi bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid bsgom par bya zhing shes par bya ste rim pa 'dis yud kyis te de'i skad cig gi ye shes rdzogs pa ni ting nge 'dzin te yan lag drug po'i zhes
analyzed: brtan pa dang g-yo ba de'i dbus su zung 'jug gi bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid bsgom par bya zhing shes par bya ste rim pa 'dis yud kyis te de'i skad cig gi ye shes rdzogs pa ni ting nge 'dzin te yan lag drug po'i zhes
translated: One should meditate on and understand that in the middle of that, which is both stable and moving, is the nature of union, Great Vajradhara. By this process, the perfection of wisdom in an instant, in a moment, is meditative concentration.

original: pa 'dus pa'i rim pas yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor gyi rim pa'o //
analyzed: pa 'dus pa'i rim pas yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor gyi rim pa'o //
translated: The six limbs are the six-limbed yoga by the process of the gathering.🔽By things to be meditated upon, etc.,

original: dngos po bsgom bya zhes pa la sogs pas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po bsgom bya zhes pa la sogs pas zhes pa ni /
translated: it is said:

original: dngos po sgom 'gyur shes rab can //
analyzed: dngos po sgom 'gyur shes rab can //
translated: The wise one meditates on things,

original: dngos po med pa'ang yongs shes pas //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'ang yongs shes pas //
translated: and also fully understands non-things.

original: de ltar he ru ka bsgom bya //
analyzed: de ltar he ru ka bsgom bya //
translated: Thus one meditates on Heruka.

original: dngos po yongs su shes pas min //
analyzed: dngos po yongs su shes pas min //
translated: Not by fully understanding things.

original: zhes dpal kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud du gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes dpal kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud du gsungs so //
translated: This is taught in the Shri Heruka Tantra.

original: stobs bcu'i stobs dang ldan pas ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen pos so //
analyzed: stobs bcu'i stobs dang ldan pas ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen pos so //
translated: By the power of the ten powers, it is the Great Vajra Holder.

original: stong nyid sgom pa ni rnam pa thams cad pa'i stong pa nyid rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: stong nyid sgom pa ni rnam pa thams cad pa'i stong pa nyid rtogs pa'o //
translated: Meditating on emptiness is realizing emptiness in all aspects.

original: mtshan mo ni mun pa la ste nyin par ni snang ba la'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo ni mun pa la ste nyin par ni snang ba la'o //
translated: Night is in the dark, and day is in the light.

original: dus gsum gzugs ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: dus gsum gzugs ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The form of the three times is the nature of the desire, form, and formless [realms].

original: mun pa can du ni aa wa dh'u t'ir ro //
analyzed: mun pa can du ni aa wa dh'u t'ir ro //
translated: In the dark, [it is] in the avadhūti.

original: phyi rol du 'byung ba med pa'i phyir dbugs 'byung dbugs rngub dman pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du 'byung ba med pa'i phyir dbugs 'byung dbugs rngub dman pa'o //
translated: Exhalation and inhalation are weak because there is no external arising.

original: gang gi gzugs las ni sna tshogs pa'i gzugs brnyan pas so //
analyzed: gang gi gzugs las ni sna tshogs pa'i gzugs brnyan pas so //
translated: From whose form? From the form of the various reflections.

original: nam mkhar lta bas ni par snang la gtang ba'i mig gis so //
analyzed: nam mkhar lta bas ni par snang la gtang ba'i mig gis so //
translated: By looking at the sky, with eyes cast into space.

original: gti mug mthar byed pa ni rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gti mug mthar byed pa ni rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
translated: The end of delusion is the absence of intrinsic nature.

original: de yang spyan ma'o //
analyzed: de yang spyan ma'o //
translated: And that is Locanā.

original: nang gi lta bas te phung po dang / skye mched la sogs pa nyid du lta bas 'dod chags mthar byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: nang gi lta bas te phung po dang / skye mched la sogs pa nyid du lta bas 'dod chags mthar byed pa nyid do //
translated: By looking inwardly, by looking at the aggregates, sense bases, and so forth, is the end of attachment.

original: de yang gos dkar mo'o //
analyzed: de yang gos dkar mo'o //
translated: And that is Māmakī.

original: lus med lta bas ni rnam pa thams cad mchog dang @326a * //
analyzed: lus med lta bas ni rnam pa thams cad mchog dang @326a * //
translated: By looking without a body, with the eyes of wisdom, is the end of pride.🔽And that is Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: ldan pa'i stong pa nyid kyi gzugs kyis lhan cig skyes pa la rjes su chags pa'i lta bas so //
analyzed: ldan pa'i stong pa nyid kyi gzugs kyis lhan cig skyes pa la rjes su chags pa'i lta bas so //
translated: By the form of emptiness endowed with the supreme of all aspects, one should view the connate [joy] with the view of passion.

original: zhe sdang ste 'jig rten pa'i zhe sdang mthar byed nyid de rang bzhin med pa nyid dang sgrib pa med pa nyid de zhe sdang chen po nyid do //
analyzed: zhe sdang ste 'jig rten pa'i zhe sdang mthar byed nyid de rang bzhin med pa nyid dang sgrib pa med pa nyid de zhe sdang chen po nyid do //
translated: Hatred is the end of worldly hatred, that is, the absence of intrinsic nature and the absence of obscurations, which is great hatred.

original: de yang rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma'o //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma'o //
translated: And that is Vajradhātvīśvarī.

original: khu ba gang dri ma med pa nyid kyi gang bde ba ste de las so //
analyzed: khu ba gang dri ma med pa nyid kyi gang bde ba ste de las so //
translated: From the semen, which is stainless, that is, bliss, there, that is, from that,

original: srog gi lta bas te sna'i sa nye bar mtshon pa'i bar snang gi phyogs su lta bas nga rgyal te tha mal pa'i nga rgyal mthar byed nyid de sgrib pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: srog gi lta bas te sna'i sa nye bar mtshon pa'i bar snang gi phyogs su lta bas nga rgyal te tha mal pa'i nga rgyal mthar byed nyid de sgrib pa med pa nyid do //
translated: by the view of life, that is, by the view in the space direction indicated by the nose, is pride, the end of ordinary pride, that is, the absence of obscurations.

original: de yang m'a ma k'i'o //
analyzed: de yang m'a ma k'i'o //
translated: And that is Māmakī.

original: gzhom du med pa'i tshangs pa'i dbyangs las te gzhom du med pa'i bde ba chen po'i sgra'i yang dag par rol pa las so //
analyzed: gzhom du med pa'i tshangs pa'i dbyangs las te gzhom du med pa'i bde ba chen po'i sgra'i yang dag par rol pa las so //
translated: From the play of the invincible Brahmā voice, that is, from the play of the invincible great-bliss sound,

original: srog dang rtsol ba 'gags par gyur na ste phyi rol du 'gro ba med pas 'dzin pa'i yan lag gsal bar gyur pas na rnam par rtog pa med pa lhan cig skyes pa'i gtum mo gsal bar gyur ba'i phyir na sangs rgyas gzugs las te sna tshogs pa'i
analyzed: srog dang rtsol ba 'gags par gyur na ste phyi rol du 'gro ba med pas 'dzin pa'i yan lag gsal bar gyur pas na rnam par rtog pa med pa lhan cig skyes pa'i gtum mo gsal bar gyur ba'i phyir na sangs rgyas gzugs las te sna tshogs pa'i
translated: When the life-force and āyāma are arrested, since there is no exhalation, the branch of retention becomes clear. Since nonconceptual, connate caṇḍālī becomes clear, the “buddhas” arise from the “form” of the buddhas—that is, from the various appearances of the vāyu and mind.🔽

original: gzugs las dri ma dang bral dkyil 'khor te dri ma med pa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor du 'gyur te skye'o //
analyzed: gzugs las dri ma dang bral dkyil 'khor te dri ma med pa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor du 'gyur te skye'o //
translated: When the life and exertion have ceased, that is, when there is no going outside, the branch of retention becomes clear, and because the nonconceptual innate candall is made clear, the mandala of stainless light, that is, the mandala of the form of the Buddha, arises from the form of the various🔽deities.

original: 'jig rten gsum gyi phrag dog zad pa'i phyir de ni sgrol ma'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gyi phrag dog zad pa'i phyir de ni sgrol ma'o //
translated: Because the envy of the three worlds is destroyed, she is Tara.

original: 'khor lo drug rnams su khu ba son pas rdul 'og tu 'gro bas so //
analyzed: 'khor lo drug rnams su khu ba son pas rdul 'og tu 'gro bas so //
translated: Because the semen has gone below, to the six cakras, she is Paravrtta, the supreme reversal.🔽Because she is the destroyer of the demon of death, she is Ucchushma.

original: gzhom du med pa'i tshangs pa'i dbyangs las te /
analyzed: gzhom du med pa'i tshangs pa'i dbyangs las te /
translated: Because she is the destroyer of the demon of the afflictions, she is Ugra.🔽Because she is the destroyer of the demon of the lord of death, she is Krodheshvari.🔽Because she is the destroyer of the demon of the devaputra, she is Mahabala.🔽Because she is the destroyer of the demon of the aggregates, she is Mahabala.🔽Because she is the destroyer of the demon of the afflictions, she is Mahabala.

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba chen po cher rol ba'i phyir ser sna mthar byed nyid do //🔽de yang sna tshogs yum mo //
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba chen po cher rol ba'i phyir ser sna mthar byed nyid do //🔽de yang sna tshogs yum mo //
translated: Because she is the destroyer of the demon of the lord of death, she is Mahabala.🔽Because she is the destroyer of the demon of the devaputra, she is Mahabala.🔽Because she is the destroyer of the demon of the aggregates, she is Mahabala.🔽Because she is the destroyer of the demon of the afflictions, she is Mahabala.🔽Because she is the destroyer of the demon of the lord of death, she is Mahabala.🔽Because she is the destroyer of the demon of the devaputra, she is Mahabala.🔽Because she is the destroyer of the demon of the aggregates, she is Mahabala.🔽Because she is the destroyer of the demon of the afflictions, she is Mahabala.🔽Because she is the destroyer of the demon of the lord of death, she is Mahabala.🔽Because she is the destroyer of the demon of the devaputra, she is Mahabala.🔽Because she is the destroyer of the demon of the aggregates, she is Mahabala.🔽Because she is the destroyer of the demon of the afflictions, she is Mahabala.🔽Because she is the destroyer of the demon of the lord of death, she is Mahabala.🔽Because she is the destroyer of the demon of the devaputra, she is Mahabala.🔽Because she is the destroyer of the demon of the aggregates, she is Mahabala.

original: de ltar 'khor lo so sor sa gnyis thob pa'i rim pas sa bcu gnyis kyi dbang phyug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'khor lo so sor sa gnyis thob pa'i rim pas sa bcu gnyis kyi dbang phyug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by the sequence of attaining two stages in each cakra, one becomes the lord of the twelve stages.

original: de ltar ni gsang ba'i 'khor lor dbugs dbyung ba dang 'jug pa brgya phrag drug gis lhag pa'i stong phrag gsum 'gogs pas rab tu dga' ba dang dri ma med pa'i sa gnyis so //
analyzed: de ltar ni gsang ba'i 'khor lor dbugs dbyung ba dang 'jug pa brgya phrag drug gis lhag pa'i stong phrag gsum 'gogs pas rab tu dga' ba dang dri ma med pa'i sa gnyis so //
translated: In this way, by the cessation of three thousand and six hundred breaths in excess in the secret cakra, there are the two stages of the Joyous and the Stainless.

original: lte ba'i 'khor lor de bzhin kho nar 'gags pas 'od byed pa dang 'od 'phro ba'i sa gnyis so //
analyzed: lte ba'i 'khor lor de bzhin kho nar 'gags pas 'od byed pa dang 'od 'phro ba'i sa gnyis so //
translated: In the same way, by the cessation in the navel cakra, there are the two stages of the Radiant and the Brilliant.

original: de bzhin kho nar snying ga'i chu skyes su shin tu thub par dka' ba dang / mngon du gyur ba'i sa gnyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin kho nar snying ga'i chu skyes su shin tu thub par dka' ba dang / mngon du gyur ba'i sa gnyis so //
translated: In the same way, in the lotus of the heart, there are the two stages of the Hard-to-Conquer and the Manifest.

original: mgrin pa'i padmar yang ring du song pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i sa gnyis so //
analyzed: mgrin pa'i padmar yang ring du song pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i sa gnyis so //
translated: In the lotus of the throat, there are the two stages of the Gone Afar and the Immovable.

original: smin mtshams kyi chu skyes su legs pa'i blo gros dang / chos kyi sprin gyis gnyis so //
analyzed: smin mtshams kyi chu skyes su legs pa'i blo gros dang / chos kyi sprin gyis gnyis so //
translated: In the lotus of the brow, there are the two stages of the Excellent Wisdom and the Cloud of Dharma.

original: 'di rnams byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams te lnga kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams te lnga kho na'o //
translated: These are the five bodhisattva stages.

original: de bzhin du gtsug tor gyi @326b 'khor lor sangs rgyas kyi sa kun du 'od dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sa ye shes dang ldan pa ste gnyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gtsug tor gyi @326b 'khor lor sangs rgyas kyi sa kun du 'od dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sa ye shes dang ldan pa ste gnyis so //
translated: Likewise, in the crown cakra, the two are the Buddha level, All-Illumination, and the Vajra-Holder level, Endowed with Wisdom.

original: de ltar dbugs brgya phrag drug gis lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig 'gog pas dri ma gsum dang rnam par bral ba'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rjes bcu gnyis kyi dbang phyug rnam par rtog pa med par chos ston ba po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das
analyzed: de ltar dbugs brgya phrag drug gis lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig 'gog pas dri ma gsum dang rnam par bral ba'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rjes bcu gnyis kyi dbang phyug rnam par rtog pa med par chos ston ba po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das
translated: Thus, with six hundred breaths, twenty-one thousand are stopped, and the body, speech, and mind vajras, free from the three stains, are the twelve lords, the non-conceptual teachers of the Dharma, the Bhagavān Buddhas.

original: so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: so zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus it is.

original: rim pa 'dis rnal 'byor yan lag drug mngon du byed pas sa la sogs pa drug dag pa bstan to //
analyzed: rim pa 'dis rnal 'byor yan lag drug mngon du byed pas sa la sogs pa drug dag pa bstan to //
translated: By this process, the manifestation of the six-branched yoga is the teaching of the purities of the six, earth, etc.🔽The five eyes should be individually described.

original: mig lnga rnams so sor srid pa brjod par bya ste //
analyzed: mig lnga rnams so sor srid pa brjod par bya ste //
translated: The five eyes are the divine eye, the fleshly eye, the dharma eye, the wisdom eye, and the buddha eye.🔽The divine eye is the eye of the gods, and so on.🔽The fleshly eye is the eye of humans, and so on.🔽The dharma eye is the eye of the śrāvakas.🔽The wisdom eye is the eye of the pratyekabuddhas.🔽The buddha eye is the eye of the buddhas.🔽The five eyes are the divine eye, the fleshly eye, the dharma eye, the wisdom eye, and the buddha eye.🔽The divine eye is the eye of the gods, and so on.🔽The fleshly eye is the eye of humans, and so on.🔽The dharma eye is the eye of the śrāvakas.🔽The wisdom eye is the eye of the pratyekabuddhas.🔽The buddha eye is the eye of the buddhas.🔽The five eyes are the divine eye, the fleshly eye, the dharma eye, the wisdom eye, and the buddha eye.🔽The divine eye is the eye of the gods, and so on.

original: khyi la sogs pa rnams kyi zhes pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: khyi la sogs pa rnams kyi zhes pa la sogs pas so //
translated: The fleshly eye is the eye of humans, and so on.🔽The dharma eye is the eye of the śrāvakas.🔽The wisdom eye is the eye of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: rang bzhin yon tan dbang las te rigs kyi yon tan gyi dbang las so //
analyzed: rang bzhin yon tan dbang las te rigs kyi yon tan gyi dbang las so //
translated: The buddha eye is the eye of the buddhas.🔽The five eyes are the divine eye, the fleshly eye, the dharma eye, the wisdom eye, and the buddha eye.🔽The divine eye is the eye of the gods, and so on.🔽The fleshly eye is the eye of humans, and so on.🔽The dharma eye is the eye of the śrāvakas.🔽The wisdom eye is the eye of the pratyek

original: da ni rnal 'byor yan lag drug sgrib pa med par byas pa'i 'khor lo drug gi padma'i ze 'brur gnas pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi bdag nyid du gsungs pa 'dzag med ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni rnal 'byor yan lag drug sgrib pa med par byas pa'i 'khor lo drug gi padma'i ze 'brur gnas pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi bdag nyid du gsungs pa 'dzag med ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, the six wheels, located in the pistils of the lotuses, are said to be the nature of the six Tathagatas, by the words “the non-emission, etc.

original: badzra dhri ka ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: badzra dhri ka ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: Vajradhṛk is Akṣobhya.

original: dzi na dzi ka ni rnam par snang mdzad da //
analyzed: dzi na dzi ka ni rnam par snang mdzad da //
translated: Jinajñānin is Vairocana.

original: a'a ro li ka ni 'od dpag med do //
analyzed: a'a ro li ka ni 'od dpag med do //
translated: Arolik is Amitābha.

original: ratna dhri ka ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: ratna dhri ka ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: Ratnadhṛk is Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: pradzny'a dhri ka chi don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: pradzny'a dhri ka chi don yod grub pa'o //
translated: Prajñādhṛk is Amoghasiddhi.

original: 'dis ni phung po drug rnam par dag pa gsungs so //🔽zla ba dang nyi ma'i gzugs te brkyang ma dang ro ma'i rang gi ngo bo nyams te zhig cing lam gnyis ka ste sna bug gnyis por srog gi rlung 'gags te srog dang thur sel gyi rlung phyi rol du 'gro ba med pa'i phyir 'khor lo lnga'i rnam
analyzed: 'dis ni phung po drug rnam par dag pa gsungs so // zla ba dang nyi ma'i gzugs te brkyang ma dang ro ma'i rang gi ngo bo nyams te zhig cing lam gnyis ka ste sna bug gnyis por srog gi rlung 'gags te srog dang thur sel gyi rlung phyi rol du 'gro ba med pa'i phyir 'khor lo lnga'i rnam
translated: This teaches the purification of the six aggregates.

original: par gnas pa na'o //
analyzed: par gnas pa na'o //
translated: The forms of the moon and sun, the nature of the lalanā and rasanā, are destroyed and fall away, and the two paths, the two nostrils, are blocked by the prāṇa-vāyu, because the prāṇa and apāna vāyus do not move outside.🔽The vāyu and mind gather in the five wheels,

original: chu skyes su ste stong pa nyid kyi gzugs gsal bar gyur pa la'am phyi rol gyi bud med kyi padmar ro //
analyzed: chu skyes su ste stong pa nyid kyi gzugs gsal bar gyur pa la'am phyi rol gyi bud med kyi padmar ro //
translated: In the lotus, that is, in the form of emptiness, which is clear, or in the external woman’s lotus.

original: rdo rje ste sems kyi rdo rje'am bo la ru'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ste sems kyi rdo rje'am bo la ru'o //
translated: The vajra is the mind-vajra or the phallus.

original: rab tu sang pa na ste sngar bshad pa'i rim pas bslang ba na ste rdo rje langs pa na zhes pa'i don to ;
analyzed: rab tu sang pa na ste sngar bshad pa'i rim pas bslang ba na ste rdo rje langs pa na zhes pa'i don to ;
translated: When it is fully erect, that is, when it is aroused by the previously explained process, when the vajra is erect,

original: / de'i tshe ri bong can zhu ba gang yin pa ni khu ba'o //
analyzed: / de'i tshe ri bong can zhu ba gang yin pa ni khu ba'o //
translated: at that time, the melted rabbit is the semen.

original: der nyi ma'i gzugs chen ni lhan cig skyes pa'i gtum mo'i gzugs kyi rten la rab tu zhugs par gyur cing zla ba zhu bar gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: der nyi ma'i gzugs chen ni lhan cig skyes pa'i gtum mo'i gzugs kyi rten la rab tu zhugs par gyur cing zla ba zhu bar gyur pa na'o //
translated: In that, the great form of the sun, the form of innate caṇḍālī, enters the support, when the moon melts.

original: dngos po dngos med gcig gyur na ste stong pa nyid dang snying rdze dbyer med pa na'o //
analyzed: dngos po dngos med gcig gyur na ste stong pa nyid dang snying rdze dbyer med pa na'o //
translated: When existence and nonexistence become one, that is, when emptiness and compassion are inseparable.

original: srid pa gsum gyi 'jigs pa song ba na ste lus dang ngag dang sems kyi dri ma bral na'o //
analyzed: srid pa gsum gyi 'jigs pa song ba na ste lus dang ngag dang sems kyi dri ma bral na'o //
translated: When the fear of the three worlds is gone, that is, when the taints of body, speech, and mind are removed.

original: gzhom du med pa na ste /
analyzed: gzhom du med pa na ste /
translated: When it is invincible, that is,

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba chen pos cher rol cing yang dag rab tu rtogs par gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba chen pos cher rol cing yang dag rab tu rtogs par gyur pa na'o //
translated: When he is greatly sporting with the supreme unchanging great bliss, and has attained perfect realization.

original: de'i dus su ste bde ba chen po 'char ba'i skad cig la'o //
analyzed: de'i dus su ste bde ba chen po 'char ba'i skad cig la'o //
translated: At that time, in the moment of the arising of great bliss.

original: rnal 'byor pa de ni rnal 'byor yan lag drug mngon du @327a * //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa de ni rnal 'byor yan lag drug mngon du @327a * //
translated: That yogi, the one who has actualized the six-branched yoga,

original: byed pa po mchog gi go 'phang ste lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i bde ba la rab tu gnas par 'gro'o //
analyzed: byed pa po mchog gi go 'phang ste lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i bde ba la rab tu gnas par 'gro'o //
translated: goes to the supreme state, which is the abiding in the bliss of the innate joy.

original: gang la ste rnal 'byor pa la gnyis te rang dang gzhan du zhen ba'i mtshan nyid can cung yod min pa'o //
analyzed: gang la ste rnal 'byor pa la gnyis te rang dang gzhan du zhen ba'i mtshan nyid can cung yod min pa'o //
translated: To whom? To the yogi, who has no duality, which is characterized by the clinging to self and other.

original: srog dang thur sel gyi rlung 'gags par gyur pa na /
analyzed: srog dang thur sel gyi rlung 'gags par gyur pa na /
translated: When the life and downward-voiding winds are arrested,

original: gtum mo 'bar bas bskyod cing zhu ba'i ri bong 'dzin pa gang yin pa nyi ma'i gzugs la rab tu 'gro ste 'khyud par byed do //
analyzed: gtum mo 'bar bas bskyod cing zhu ba'i ri bong 'dzin pa gang yin pa nyi ma'i gzugs la rab tu 'gro ste 'khyud par byed do //
translated: the rabbit-holder, which is moved by the blazing candali and melted, goes to the form of the sun, and embraces it.

original: rdo rje byang chub kyi sems te /
analyzed: rdo rje byang chub kyi sems te /
translated: The vajra is the bodhicitta.

original: padma rnams ni 'khor lo rnams so //
analyzed: padma rnams ni 'khor lo rnams so //
translated: The lotuses are the chakras.

original: de rnams su rab tu sad pa na ste sngar brjod pa'i rim pas langs pa na ste /
analyzed: de rnams su rab tu sad pa na ste sngar brjod pa'i rim pas langs pa na ste /
translated: When those are fully awakened, i.e., when one arises by the previously described process,

original: de ltar gyur pa na'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa na'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: thus it is, is the meaning.

original: zhu ba na ste zhu bar gyur pas yod pa na ste 'di ste ri bong 'dzin pa nyi ma'i gzugs kyi me lce dang lhan cig tu'o //
analyzed: zhu ba na ste zhu bar gyur pas yod pa na ste 'di ste ri bong 'dzin pa nyi ma'i gzugs kyi me lce dang lhan cig tu'o //
translated: When melting, i.e., when melting occurs, i.e., the rabbit-holder, the form of the sun, together with the flame of fire.

original: rnam par shes pa dang ye shes gcig tu 'gyur te rlung dang lhan cig zla ba dang nyi ma 'gags shing sgrib pa med par gyur pa na'o //🔽gang mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba byung ba de ni smra par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir de ltar nyams su myong bas rtogs par bya ba ae yig dang wam yig gi bdag nyid de brjod pa can gsum nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad du bden
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ye shes gcig tu 'gyur te rlung dang lhan cig zla ba dang nyi ma 'gags shing sgrib pa med par gyur pa na'o // gang mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba byung ba de ni smra par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir de ltar nyams su myong bas rtogs par bya ba ae yig dang wam yig gi bdag nyid de brjod pa can gsum nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad du bden
translated: Consciousness and intuition become one, i.e., the moon and sun together with the wind cease and become unobstructed.🔽That which is the arising of supreme unchanging bliss is inexpressible, thus it is to be realized by experience, having the nature of the letters E and VAM.

original: pa nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: pa nyid gsungs so //
translated: The three with expression are said to be completely true.

original: mtshan ma'i rnam par dag pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i rnam par dag pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: The purity of the signs should be stated.

original: 'khor lo zhes pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: 'khor lo zhes pa la sogs pas so //
translated: The wheel, etc.

original: srid gsum zhes pa kun nas rmongs pa rnams smin pa'i ched du rnam par snang mdzad kyi 'khor lo shin tu dang ba'o //
analyzed: srid gsum zhes pa kun nas rmongs pa rnams smin pa'i ched du rnam par snang mdzad kyi 'khor lo shin tu dang ba'o //
translated: The three worlds are the wheel of Vairocana, extremely clear, for the sake of ripening those who are completely deluded.

original: srid pa gsum po 'di nyid kyi bde ba'i don du rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rin chen no //
analyzed: srid pa gsum po 'di nyid kyi bde ba'i don du rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rin chen no //
translated: The jewels of Ratnasaṃbhava are for the sake of the bliss of just these three worlds.

original: sgrib pa med pa'i 'du shes kyi chos kyis chags pa can rnams kyi chags pa chen po'i rgyur 'od dpag tu med pa'i padma'o /
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa'i 'du shes kyi chos kyis chags pa can rnams kyi chags pa chen po'i rgyur 'od dpag tu med pa'i padma'o /
translated: The lotus of Amitābha is the cause of the great passion of those who are passionate due to the Dharma of the perception of nonobstruction.

original: nyon mongs zad pa zhes pa don yod grub pa'i ral gri'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs zad pa zhes pa don yod grub pa'i ral gri'o //
translated: The sword of Amoghasiddhi is the exhaustion of afflictions.

original: mi phyed pa'i ye shes sku zhes pa mi bskyod pa'i rdo rje'o //
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i ye shes sku zhes pa mi bskyod pa'i rdo rje'o //
translated: The vajra of Akṣobhya is the body of indivisible gnosis.

original: mi shes gcod pa zhes pa rigs drug pa'i gri gug go //
analyzed: mi shes gcod pa zhes pa rigs drug pa'i gri gug go //
translated: The flaying knife of the sixth buddha family is the severing of ignorance.

original: rigs drug po 'di rnams kyis mkha' bzhin ro mnyam rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: rigs drug po 'di rnams kyis mkha' bzhin ro mnyam rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams so //
translated: These six buddha families are the nature of form and so on, which are undifferentiated, like space, and unchanging.

original: gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is also said:

original: rdo rje sems dpa' gcig pu 'di ni 'jigs pa'i sprin dang mtshungs pa'i he ru ka 'di byung bar gyur //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' gcig pu 'di ni 'jigs pa'i sprin dang mtshungs pa'i he ru ka 'di byung bar gyur //
translated: This single Vajrasattva became this Heruka, who is like a cloud of fear.

original: gdug pa rnams ni smin pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: gdug pa rnams ni smin pa'i don du'o //
translated: For the sake of the maturation of the wicked.🔽And that is also:

original: de yang / dam tshig rgyal pa rmongs pa rnams ni bde don du //
analyzed: de yang / dam tshig rgyal pa rmongs pa rnams ni bde don du //
translated: The pledge-king for the deluded, for the sake of bliss.

original: rin chen dbang po sdug bsngal ldan pa @327b rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: rin chen dbang po sdug bsngal ldan pa @327b rnams kyi'o //
translated: The jewel-lord for those who are suffering.

original: de yang pad 'dzin chags can rnams kyi chags pa'i rgyur //
analyzed: de yang pad 'dzin chags can rnams kyi chags pa'i rgyur //
translated: And that lotus-holder is the cause of passion for the passionate.

original: bgegs rnams gzhig pa'i don du phyag gi padma ral gri can gyi don yod grub par byung bar gyur //
analyzed: bgegs rnams gzhig pa'i don du phyag gi padma ral gri can gyi don yod grub par byung bar gyur //
translated: For the sake of destroying obstacles, Amoghasiddhi arose, with a lotus and a sword in his hand.

original: zhe sdang las ni sna tshogs yum gang 'jig dus rtse mo can mtshungs mkha' 'gro ma de byung bar gyur //
analyzed: zhe sdang las ni sna tshogs yum gang 'jig dus rtse mo can mtshungs mkha' 'gro ma de byung bar gyur //
translated: From hatred, the mother of the various, the dakini who is like the peak of time, arose.

original: gti mug las ni spyan ma zhes bya'o mchog gi thugs rjes m'a ma k'i ni nga rgyal rgyu las so //
analyzed: gti mug las ni spyan ma zhes bya'o mchog gi thugs rjes m'a ma k'i ni nga rgyal rgyu las so //
translated: From delusion, the supreme mother of compassion, Mamaki, arose from pride.

original: chags las gos dkar can zhes bya ste mtha' dag yon tan gter gyi sgron ma de yang phrag dog las //
analyzed: chags las gos dkar can zhes bya ste mtha' dag yon tan gter gyi sgron ma de yang phrag dog las //
translated: From passion, the one called Pāṇḍaravāsinī arose, and that lamp of the treasure of all good qualities arose from envy.

original: sna tshogs gzugs can gnyis 'di dag dang yul dang yul can gzhan rnams thams cad rnams kyang byung bar gyur //
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs can gnyis 'di dag dang yul dang yul can gzhan rnams thams cad rnams kyang byung bar gyur //
translated: These two, having various forms, and all the other subjects and objects, have arisen.

original: zhes so // rigs kyi gzugs ni tha mal pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: zhes so // rigs kyi gzugs ni tha mal pa'i gzugs so //
translated: The form of the family is the ordinary form.

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: The feeling is the feeling of the suffering of samsara and so forth.

original: de bzhin du phyi ma la yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi ma la yang ngo //
translated: The same goes for the subsequent ones.

original: mthong dang ma mthong ba ni bar chod pa dang ma chod pa'o //
analyzed: mthong dang ma mthong ba ni bar chod pa dang ma chod pa'o //
translated: The seen and unseen are the obstructed and unobstructed.

original: yid kyi nam mkha' la ni sems med pa'i sems la'o //
analyzed: yid kyi nam mkha' la ni sems med pa'i sems la'o //
translated: In the space of the mind is the mind without mind.

original: bde mnyam la ni mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba la'o //
analyzed: bde mnyam la ni mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba la'o //
translated: In the bliss of equality is unchanging bliss.

original: chos ni chos kyi dbyings la'o //
analyzed: chos ni chos kyi dbyings la'o //
translated: The Dharma is the dharmadhatu.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad gsungs te //🔽kun la phyag dang zhabs la sogs //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad gsungs te // kun la phyag dang zhabs la sogs //
translated: This is what is being said:🔽All have hands and feet, and so forth.

original: kun nas spyan dang dbu dang zhal //🔽kun nas thos ldan 'jig rten du //
analyzed: kun nas spyan dang dbu dang zhal // kun nas thos ldan 'jig rten du //
translated: All have eyes, heads, and faces.🔽All have ears, and abide

original: thams cad khyab gnas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad khyab gnas gnas pa'o //
translated: in the world, pervading everything.

original: zhes so // gzugs la ni gzugs brnyan la ste mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba la gzugs la sogs pa rnams ma skyes shing ma 'gags pa rnams so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes so // gzugs la ni gzugs brnyan la ste mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba la gzugs la sogs pa rnams ma skyes shing ma 'gags pa rnams so zhes pa'o //
translated: In form, in the reflection, in unchanging bliss, forms and so forth are unborn and unceasing.

original: rnyog med ni lus dang sems rtsub pa rnams kyis ma dkrugs pa'o //
analyzed: rnyog med ni lus dang sems rtsub pa rnams kyis ma dkrugs pa'o //
translated: Unpolluted, not disturbed by the coarseness of body and mind.

original: ye shes kyis rtogs bya ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i rig pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyis rtogs bya ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i rig pa'o //
translated: To be realized by wisdom, the supreme unchanging knowledge.

original: dbang po'i sgos rtogs par bya ba'i gzung bar bya ba gzhan yod pa min no zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i sgos rtogs par bya ba'i gzung bar bya ba gzhan yod pa min no zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: Not to be realized by the sense organs, not to be apprehended by another.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis rtogs bya min pa ni 'di nyid kyis zhes so sor rtogs par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis rtogs bya min pa ni 'di nyid kyis zhes so sor rtogs par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Not to be realized by the buddhas, because it cannot be realized by them, by this very fact.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ste rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sprul pa sgyu ma lta bu sna tshogs yum ni sangs rgyas sprul pa sgyu ma'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ste rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sprul pa sgyu ma lta bu sna tshogs yum ni sangs rgyas sprul pa sgyu ma'o //
translated: The emanation of the buddhas, the various illusory mothers, is the illusory emanation of the buddhas.

original: brgya byin dra ba ni mig 'phrul lo ;
analyzed: brgya byin dra ba ni mig 'phrul lo ;
translated: Indra’s net is an optical illusion.

original: / chu la nam mkhar mthong ba'i 'khrul pa de dang 'dra bar skye ba kho nar 'dir 'khrul pa ster ba'o //
analyzed: / chu la nam mkhar mthong ba'i 'khrul pa de dang 'dra bar skye ba kho nar 'dir 'khrul pa ster ba'o //
translated: Just like the error of seeing water in the sky, so too is the error here, which is only born.

original: ro'i rdo rje rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa drug rnams so //
analyzed: ro'i rdo rje rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa drug rnams so //
translated: The “vajras of corpses” are the six transcendent lords.

original: sa gzhi'i snying po la sogs pa rnams ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa rnams so //🔽grub pa'i dus su ni phyag rgya chen po grub pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: sa gzhi'i snying po la sogs pa rnams ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa rnams so // grub pa'i dus su ni phyag rgya chen po grub pa'i dus su'o //
translated: “Kṣitigarbha, etc.” are Kṣitigarbha and so on.

original: tho rangs la @328a * //
analyzed: tho rangs la @328a * //
translated: “At the time of accomplishment” is at the time of the accomplishment of the great seal.

original: ni skya rengs 'char ba'i dus la'o //
analyzed: ni skya rengs 'char ba'i dus la'o //
translated: “At dawn” is at the time of the rising of the dawn.

original: mtshan mo phyed la yang ste de yang 'grub pa'i dus yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan mo phyed la yang ste de yang 'grub pa'i dus yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “At midnight” is also the time of accomplishment.

original: ri bang can gyi zhag ni zla ba nya ba la'o //
analyzed: ri bang can gyi zhag ni zla ba nya ba la'o //
translated: “At the time of the full moon” is the full moon.

original: 'dod pa'i dngos grub ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bo //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dngos grub ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bo //
translated: “The desired power” is the power of the great seal.

original: dus kyi sbyor ba las ni phyogs gsum dang lo gsum gyi sbyor ba las so //
analyzed: dus kyi sbyor ba las ni phyogs gsum dang lo gsum gyi sbyor ba las so //
translated: “From the combination of time” is from the combination of the three directions and the three years.

original: rdo rje'i gnas ni de kho na nyid kyi gnas te lhag par gnas pa ba kun nas 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: rdo rje'i gnas ni de kho na nyid kyi gnas te lhag par gnas pa ba kun nas 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The vajra site is the site of reality, characterized by the arising of the special abode.

original: dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa rgyud sna tshogs pa rnams kyi zhes pa la sogs pa'i sgras ni dpal 'dus pa dang bde mchog dang kye'i rdo rje dang mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje'i gur rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa rgyud sna tshogs pa rnams kyi zhes pa la sogs pa'i sgras ni dpal 'dus pa dang bde mchog dang kye'i rdo rje dang mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje'i gur rnams bsdu'o //
translated: The words of various tantras and so forth in the first line of the verse refer to the glorious Guhyasamaja, Heruka, Hevajra, and Vajra-pavara-dakini-daka.

original: gang gi bla ma la gus phongs la brtse dang 'phags pa 'jam pa'i dpal gyi ni /
analyzed: gang gi bla ma la gus phongs la brtse dang 'phags pa 'jam pa'i dpal gyi ni /
translated: He who is devoted to his guru, compassionate to the poor, and🔽devoted to listening to the Dharma of the noble Manjusri,

original: padma bsten zhing rang bzhin ngag dag chos ni nyan par byed la shin tu chags //
analyzed: padma bsten zhing rang bzhin ngag dag chos ni nyan par byed la shin tu chags //
translated: who is a lotus-like friend, and whose speech is pure by nature,🔽that one is known as the glorious supreme protector and guide.

original: dpal ldan skyong mchog 'dren pa zhes par grags pa de yis chos la gnas pa la //🔽phyi phyir gsol ba btab pas yan lag drug po 'gengs byed brjod byang bdag gis spros //
analyzed: dpal ldan skyong mchog 'dren pa zhes par grags pa de yis chos la gnas pa la // phyi phyir gsol ba btab pas yan lag drug po 'gengs byed brjod byang bdag gis spros //
translated: He, abiding in the Dharma,🔽again and again made requests, and I, the author of the Vyakhyayukti, composed this filling of the six-limbed yoga.

original: rnal 'byor yan lag drug gi brjed byang ni //
analyzed: rnal 'byor yan lag drug gi brjed byang ni //
translated: The Vyakhyayukti of the Six-Limbed Yoga

original: bdag gis byas nas gang zhig thob pa yi //
analyzed: bdag gis byas nas gang zhig thob pa yi //
translated: Having done this, what will I obtain?

original: dge ba 'di yis 'jig rten ma lus pa //
analyzed: dge ba 'di yis 'jig rten ma lus pa //
translated: By this virtue of mine, may the entire world🔽attain the supreme and unchanging state.

original: mchog tu 'gyur ba med pa thob par shog / mkhas pa chen po gnas brtan nyi ma dpal ye shes kyis mdzad pa rnal 'byor yan lag drug gi brjed byang yon tan gyis 'gengs pa zhes bya ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: mchog tu 'gyur ba med pa thob par shog / mkhas pa chen po gnas brtan nyi ma dpal ye shes kyis mdzad pa rnal 'byor yan lag drug gi brjed byang yon tan gyis 'gengs pa zhes bya ba rdzogs so /
translated: The memorandum of the Six-Limbed Yoga called Filled with Qualities composed by the great scholar, elder, and sun of glory, Jnanapada, is complete.

original: // / rgya gar shar phyogs kyi pandi ta chen po shr'i bi bh'u ti tsandras ru lag gi snying po 'bring mtshams kyi sa'i cha dpal rgya rtags kyi gtsug lag khang du bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: // / rgya gar shar phyogs kyi pandi ta chen po shr'i bi bh'u ti tsandras ru lag gi snying po 'bring mtshams kyi sa'i cha dpal rgya rtags kyi gtsug lag khang du bsgyur ba'o //
translated: It was translated by the great eastern Indian pandita Shrivibhutichandra at the glorious Indian monastery of Shri Dhanyakataka in the middle of the land of Rug.

original: 'di'i gzhung gi tshad ni phyed dang bcas pa'i brgya phrag drug go //
